0.title: H'wood filmmaker approaches Vipul Amrutlal Shah for remake rights of 'Sanak'
0.article_body: Hollywood filmmaker Kylan Tyng has approached filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah for the remake rights of 'Sanak', a 2021 action-thriller film which featured Vidyut Jammwal and Neha Dhupia, among others. Talking about it, Vipul said, "I'm the only person whose two films have been inquired [about] by Hollywood for remakes...I am super excited and I really hope that this will materialise."

1.title: PM Modi, Amit Shah, Nadda among BJP campaigners for Himachal polls
1.article_body: The BJP on Friday released a list of 40 campaigners for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. The list features Prime Minister Narendra Modi, party chief JP Nadda, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Home Minister Amit Shah. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar are also included in the list.

2.title: India's growth, stability concerns are less than that of world: Finance Ministry
2.article_body: Estimating India's medium-term growth rate above 6%, the Finance Ministry said, the country's growth and stability concerns are less than that of the world at large. "A long-awaited domestic investment cycle that had started will accelerate once current external shocks – geopolitical conflicts and monetary tightening – fade...Corporate and bank balance sheets in India are ready for it.," it said.

3.title: Akshay shares fan's Phir Hera Pheri-inspired rangoli, says 'I love it'
3.article_body: Akshay Kumar responded to a fan who had tweeted a picture of a rangoli inspired by a scene from his film 'Phir Hera Pheri'. "Dear @akshaykumar, award winning rangoli in my office. I hope you like this," the fan wrote. Akshay responded, "Like this? I love it! Hope it brings a smile on all...visitors' faces like it did on mine."

4.title: Half of Ukraine's thermal production stations hit by Russian strikes: Min
4.article_body:
Ukrainian Energy Minister German Galushchenko said Russian air strikes have hit at least half of Ukraine's thermal generation capacity since October 10, resulting in billions of dollars in damage. 
However, not all of these thermal power plants have entirely stopped production, Galushchenko told Reuters. He further said that Ukraine may need electricity imports to get through the winter.

5.title: ICICI Bank's Q2 profit up by 37% to ₹7,558 cr as bad loan provisions fall
5.article_body: ICICI Bank posted a 37% year-on-year growth in standalone profit at ₹7,557.84 crore for the September quarter as against ₹5,511 crore in the corresponding period last year led by a fall in bad loan provisions. Its net interest income surged to ₹14,787 crore year-on-year compared to ₹11,690 crore last year. It registered a 25% year-on-year growth in retail loan portfolio.

6.title: Industrialist, wife & teenage daughter set themselves ablaze in B'luru
6.article_body: An industrialist, his wife and their teenage daughter died after allegedly setting themselves ablaze in Bengaluru's HSR Layout on Friday. The family from Kerala had shifted to Bengaluru a few years ago. Police said the industrialist, Santosh, ran a small tool manufacturing factory. Losses in business and failure to repay loans are the prime reasons behind the suicide, they added.

7.title: BJP will win more seats in Gujarat than last time: Anurag Thakur
7.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur exuded confidence that the BJP will win the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls and said that the party will win more seats than last time. He claimed that AAP would not be able to win a single seat in the polls. "AAP has nothing. The states in which they've formed governments are in bad shape," said Thakur.

8.title: Ask your MP to quit being Dy Chairman of RS: Kishor to Bihar CM
8.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor accused Bihar CM Nitish Kumar of continuing to be in touch with the BJP. "If you have nothing to do with BJP/ NDA then ask your MP to quit the post of Deputy Chairman of Rajya Sabha," tweeted Kishor, talking about JD(U)'s Harivansh. CM Kumar had denied the allegations and said Kishor was speaking for publicity.

9.title: Pregnant woman, mother killed as ambulance hits tree in Tamil Nadu
9.article_body: A 20-year-old pregnant woman and her mother were killed after an ambulance they were in crashed into a tree in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga district on Friday. The woman was reportedly in labour when she was travelling with her family members in the vehicle. Three other people are being treated at a hospital.

10.title: AAP Corporator Sejal Malaviya bites female security guard at Surat meeting
10.article_body: An AAP Corporator, Sejal Malaviya, reportedly bit a female security guard when she was being moved out of a meeting of the Surat Municipal Corporation's General Board in Surat. Reports said that the incident took place on Friday when BJP leader Amit Rajput tried to raise the oath issue involving Delhi's former Social Justice Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam.

11.title: Cognizant promoted 42,000 employees in FY22, spent $130 mn in hikes: Report
11.article_body: IT company Cognizant promoted around 42,000 employees in FY22 and spent $130 million (over ₹1,000 crore) in the year for merit-based and off-cycle increments, ToI reported citing an MCA filing. It also promoted 13,810 employees up to associate director levels, spending $36 million, an average increase of 14%. It also rolled out target merit assessment effective from July last year.

12.title: Texas state police fire 1st officer over Uvalde shooting which killed 19 kids
12.article_body: Texas Department of Public Safety has fired a policeman who was at the scene of the Uvalde school massacre in which 19 children and two teachers were killed. Juan Maldonado is the first state police force member to be fired in the case. A gunman armed with AR-15-style rifle went on a shooting rampage at Robb Elementary School in May.

13.title: Nigerian DJ on student visa in Pune arrested for overstay in India
13.article_body: Pune City Police has arrested the 31-year-old Nigerian DJ 'Echo Buzz' for allegedly overstaying in India. The accused had come to India on a student visa a few years ago to study at Fergusson College, police said. The DJ stayed at a housing complex in Kondhwa's Yewalewadi area and has been overstaying in the country since 2014, police added.

14.title: 978 colonies within Hyderabad ORR to receive water by March 2023
14.article_body: The work related to providing water supply to 978 colonies, located outside Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits and within Outer Ring Road (ORR), is set to be finished by March 2023. "While...construction of reservoirs is underway, the water distribution network will be built simultaneously so...there are no delays," Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board MD said.

15.title: 70,000 jobs 'oont ke muh me jeera': Surjewala on PM's Rozgar Mela
15.article_body: As PM Modi launched Rozgar Mela in which appointment letters are to be handed over to 75,000 people, the Congress called it "oont ke muh me jeera". Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "Modiji, you promised two crore jobs every year, which makes it 16 crore jobs in eight years...The youth want employment. Rahul Gandhi will keep raising their questions."

16.title: NZ record their biggest-ever T20 WC victory, win a match in Australia after 10 years
16.article_body: New Zealand defeated Australia by 89 runs in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday. It is New Zealand's biggest-ever victory (by runs) in T20 World Cup history. Further, New Zealand have registered a victory in international cricket on Australian soil after more than 10 years.

17.title: A photographer jumped on car's bonnet for Aishwarya's pic, could've died: Jaya
17.article_body: Jaya Bachchan recalled how a photographer "could have died" while trying to take Aishwarya Rai's picture after her wedding in 2007. She said, "The day we were bringing Aishwarya...for 'griha pravesh', [Amitabh] was driving the car...We'd created...podium for...media, so that they could take pictures...One guy jumped on...bonnet of car...[Amitabh] lost his cool...our security took these people on."

18.title: API, constable booked for demanding bribe of ₹50,000 in Pune
18.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials booked an assistant police inspector (API) and a police constable in Pune for demanding a bribe of ₹50,000. The constable demanded the bribe from a 27-year-old complainant for helping by not arresting his family members in a case registered against them and the API assisted him in the crime, ACB officials said.

19.title: Taliban forces kill 6 Islamic State members in raid in Kabul
19.article_body: Taliban forces killed six Islamic State members in an overnight raid on their hideout in Afghanistan's capital, Kabul, a Taliban spokesperson said on Saturday. The slain Islamic State members were involved in two major attacks in recent weeks, one on a mosque near Kabul's former "Green Zone" and the other on a tutoring institute in the city, the spokesperson added.

20.title: Giorgia Meloni sworn in as Italy's 1st female Prime Minister
20.article_body: Giorgia Meloni was sworn in as Italy's first female Prime Minister at the presidential palace on Saturday. Meloni has been politically active since she was a teenage activist in a neo-fascist party's youth wing in Rome. In 2008, Meloni became Italy's youngest ever minister in Silvio Berlusconi's government.

21.title: Conway breaks Kohli's record for smashing highest T20I score by a visiting batter in Aus
21.article_body: New Zealand opener Devon Conway on Saturday broke Virat Kohli's record for smashing the highest T20I score by a visiting batter in Australia. Conway scored 92*(58) against Australia in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Sydney to break the record. Kohli had set the previous record by scoring 90*(55) against Australia in Adelaide in 2016.

22.title: Japan, Australia leaders sign new security pact amid China threat
22.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese and his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida on Saturday signed a new bilateral security agreement amid China's growing military presence in the Asia-Pacific region. The two countries vowed to share more sensitive intelligence and conduct joint war games. "This landmark declaration sends a strong signal to the region of our strategic alignment," Albanese said.

23.title: Ex-UK PM Boris Johnson flies back from holiday to run for office
23.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, who was on holiday in the Caribbean, has flown back to Britain to run for office for the second time. This comes as his successor, Liz Truss, stepped down after serving for 45 days. Johnson received support of dozens of Conservative lawmakers but needs to secure 100 nominations to be considered for the race.

24.title: Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO who went missing may have been killed, claims Kenyan Prez's aide
24.article_body: An aide of Kenyan President William Ruto has claimed that the two missing Indians in Kenya have been killed by the disbanded DCI unit, a report said. Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Ahmad Khan and his friend Mohamed Zaid Sami Kidwai went missing alongside taxi driver Nicodemus Mwania in July. India has been in touch with Kenyan authorities on the matter.

25.title: Salman Khan recovering from dengue, to take a break from Bigg Boss 16: Report
25.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was diagnosed with dengue a few days ago and is currently on a break from his work commitments, as per reports. In his absence, Bigg Boss OTT host Karan Johar took over the weekend special episode of Bigg Boss 16. Salman is reportedly recovering and will soon get back to work.

26.title: Video of grand laser show in Ayodhya ahead of Diwali goes viral
26.article_body: A video of a grand laser show in UP's Ayodhya ahead of Diwali has gone viral on social media. The event was organised as part of the Deepotsav celebration, which Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit on Sunday. During his visit, PM Modi will also conduct an inspection of the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra's site.

27.title: Captaining is a big thing for me: Rohit ahead of India's T20 WC opener vs Pak
27.article_body: Asked about leading India ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 opener against Pakistan, Rohit Sharma said, "Captaining is a big thing for me, but playing any game for India is important for me." He added, "Occasions keep changing. I've played...World Cup final once, against Pakistan in 2007." The T20 World Cup is Rohit's first World Cup as captain.

28.title: 4 killed, 3 injured after jeep crashes into pole in MP's Shajapur
28.article_body: Four people were killed and three injured after their speeding jeep crashed into a pole in Madhya Pradesh's Shajapur district, said police on Saturday. Four of the victims died on the spot, while the other three were admitted to a government hospital, said a police official. A probe into the incident has been initiated, added the official.

29.title: ₹1.10 cr hawala cash found in Chevrolet Spark car in Hyd, 4 arrested
29.article_body: Hyderabad Police found hawala cash worth over ₹1.10 crore in a Chevrolet Spark car and arrested four people for possessing unaccounted money on Thursday. The main accused, Kamlesh Kumar, is a resident of Chudibazar. Police said he had hatched a plan to run hawala business in and around Hyderabad as he wasn't getting enough profit from his plastic bag business.

30.title: 6-yr-old succumbs to burn injuries after Pune hotel catches fire
30.article_body: A six-year-old girl, Iqra Naeem Khan, died in a fire accident at a hotel near Bhikardas Maruti Temple in the Sadashiv Peth area of Pune. She was shifted to a private hospital, where she succumbed to the burn injuries. The cause of the fire and the extent of the damage have not been identified so far.

31.title: Feels nice to get praise for a rooted, regional film: Rishab on 'Kantara'
31.article_body: Rishab Shetty in an interview thanked Kangana Ranaut for praising his film 'Kantara'. He added that it "feels nice to get praise for a rooted, regional film". "This is the story of my village...It's being loved across the globe...People are talking...about our beliefs, tradition, culture, ritual, way of life," Rishab added. Kangana had said she was "shaking" after watching 'Kantara'.

32.title: Rishi Sunak is the only man for UK PM job: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
32.article_body: Biocon Limited's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has said that Indian-origin Rishi Sunak "is the only man for the (UK) PM job". Reacting to the front page of a British newspaper that said "Could Boris (Johnson) and Rishi unite to save Tories?", the billionaire suggested that only Sunak can help the Tories in the country's economic revival and political stability.

33.title: Zelenskyy urges West to warn Russia against blowing up hydro-electric dam
33.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has urged Western countries to warn Russia against blowing up Nova Kakhovka hydro-electric dam built on the Dnipro river. "Destroying the dam would mean a large-scale disaster," Zelenskyy said, calling it a new Russian terrorist attack. Russia has accused Kyiv of planning to destroy it. Neither of the countries produced any evidence supporting their claims.

34.title: 4 members of family killed in landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli
34.article_body: Four members of a family were killed when boulders fell on several houses after a landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district at around 1 am on Saturday, said officials. The deceased included two women. According to Tharali SDM, five people were trapped under debris when the boulders fell. One of them is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

35.title: Engineer who came to cut electricity in Bihar village thrashed, video surfaces
35.article_body: Locals thrashed an engineer who had come to cut the electricity supply in Bihar's Kamtaul village. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Reports said that 10 people have been booked in the case. In the video, several people can be seen beating one man brutally while others can be seen watching.

36.title: Man arrested with 215 gm of mephedrone worth ₹43 lakh in Mumbai
36.article_body: A 37-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai's Bandra for allegedly possessing 215 grams of mephedrone worth ₹43 lakh. "He (accused) is actively involved in the supply of drugs in the city. There are 17 offences registered against his name," an official said. "He has been booked under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act," the official added.

37.title: Taylor Swift's 'Midnights' album release crashes Spotify
37.article_body: Thousands of users worldwide reported problems with accessing Spotify minutes after Taylor Swift released her 'Midnights' album on Friday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector. The issue reportedly got resolved within an hour. 'Midnights', which is the singer's 10th studio album, became the most-streamed album in a single day in Spotify's history, the music streaming platform tweeted.

38.title: Inflation not embedded in US economy: US Treasury Secretary Yellen
38.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said, "I don't believe it's (inflation) becoming embedded in the US economy". She said this when asked about the recent Consumer Price Index data showing persistent increases in non-food, non-energy core inflation factors, including rents. She also said domestic investments in semiconductors and research would help increase the country's productive capacity.

39.title: Salman Khan recovering from dengue, to take a break from Bigg Boss 16: Report
39.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was diagnosed with dengue a few days ago and is currently on a break from his work commitments, as per reports. In his absence, Bigg Boss OTT host Karan Johan took over the weekend special episode of Bigg Boss 16. Salman is reportedly recovering and will soon get back to work.

40.title: History-sheeter dies hours after being shot at close range in Thane
40.article_body: A local history-sheeter, Ganesh Jadhav, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital, hours after getting wounded in a firing incident in Thane, Maharashtra. "Around 10:30 am on Friday, some men took Jadhav to a hill in Thane city, where they demanded money from him and when he refused, they fired at him from point blank range," a police official said.

41.title: Focus is on T20 WC, not worried about what's going to happen later: Rohit on Asia Cup 2023
41.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah's remarks that India will not travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023 and will seek a neutral venue, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said that the team is focussing on the ongoing T20 World Cup. He added, "We are not worried about what is going to happen later...BCCI will make the decisions on that."

42.title: 5th body found after Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh
42.article_body: All five dead bodies have been recovered from the site where an Indian Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang on Friday. The Air Traffic Control had received a 'may day' call right before the crash, suggesting a technical or mechanical failure, the Army said. A court of inquiry has been constituted to investigate the causes of the accident.

43.title: New Zealand record their highest-ever total in T20 World Cup history
43.article_body: New Zealand registered a total of 200/3 against Australia in the first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday. It is New Zealand's highest-ever total in T20 World Cup history. Their previous highest total in a T20 World Cup had come on June 11, 2009, when they scored 198/5	against Ireland.

44.title: Complete ban on firecrackers in Delhi hurtful to Hindus: RSS affiliate
44.article_body: The economic wing of the RSS, Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM), opposed the complete ban on firecrackers in Delhi during Diwali and called it hurtful to Hindus. "We should not forget that in Tamil Nadu (Sivakasi), West Bengal and several other parts of the country, the livelihoods of more than ten lakh people depend on the firecracker industry," said SJM's Co-convenor.

45.title: Sunak is the right person to be UK's next PM: Ex-Finance Min Javid
45.article_body: Former British Finance Minister Sajid Javid on Friday endorsed Indian-origin Rishi Sunak to be the next leader of the Conservative Party and the country's Prime Minister. "It is abundantly clear that...Sunak has what it takes to match the challenges we face, he is the right person to lead our party and take the country forward," Javid tweeted.

46.title: Russia delaying passage of ships carrying Ukrainian grains: Zelenskyy
46.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has accused Russia of deliberately delaying the passage of ships carrying Ukrainian grains, adding that 150 vessels were waiting to be loaded. Zelenskyy said that 3 million metric tonnes of grains, enough to feed 10 million people, were blocked. The grain export is a part of a Turkey-brokered deal signed between Russia and Ukraine.

47.title: GST Council issues guidelines on recurring show cause notices to taxpayers
47.article_body: The GST Council has issued guidelines on recurring show cause notices to taxpayers. The Council said only the so-called jurisdictional tax authorities must issue recurring show cause notices to those under investigation even if the initial one is issued by another authority, which could be central or state officials. The tax authorities have also implemented measures to ease taxpayers' burden.

48.title: New Zealand's Devon Conway smashes highest score of T20 World Cup 2022 so far
48.article_body: New Zealand opener Devon Conway on Saturday smashed the highest individual score of T20 World Cup 2022 so far. Conway scored 92*(58) against Australia in the first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match. The previous highest score of the tournament was 86(55) registered by Scotland's Michael Jones against Ireland on October 19.

49.title: 6 arrested for possessing leopard skin in Telangana's Bhupalpally
49.article_body: Six persons were arrested in Telangana's Bhupalpally for allegedly possessing leopard skin, which they were trying to sell. Two of the accused set up a trap at Pamed near the Telangana-Chhattisgarh border and killed the leopard, said police. "They were on the way to Maharashtra to sell the leopard skin for ₹30 lakh," added police.

50.title: Ghaziabad man held nearly month after he shot wife, snatched son from her
50.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have arrested a man for allegedly shooting and injuring wife and snatching their son from her nearly a month after the incident. Reports said the accused had, on September 26, gone to Ghaziabad to meet his wife and tried to take his two-year-old son. When she resisted, he allegedly shot at her and ran away with their son.

51.title: Intimate moments of couples secretly filmed in OYO rooms; 4 arrested in Noida
51.article_body: At least four people have been arrested in Noida for allegedly filming intimate moments of couples secretly in rooms of OYO hotels. The accused allegedly blackmailed the couples and threatened to leak their videos if they did not pay up, police said. They allegedly booked rooms in hotels and placed hidden cameras in the rooms before checking out, police added.

52.title: Apple will not manufacture iPhone 14 Pro Max in India: Report
52.article_body: Apple will not manufacture iPhone 14 Pro Max in India, a report said. This comes after several reports had emerged suggesting that iPhone 14 Pro Max is being manufactured in the country. Foxconn is assembling iPhone 14 at its Sriperumbudur facility near Chennai. Apple manufactures iPhone11, iPhone12 and iPhone 13 in India at the Foxconn facility.

53.title: ₹78 crore seized from 5 locations including Razorpay premises: ED
53.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has seized ₹78 crore after conducting searches at five locations including Razorpay premises in Bengaluru in Chinese loan apps case. A month ago, searches were conducted at Paytm, Razorpay and Cashfree Payments premises. "Said entities were doing their suspected/illegal business through various merchant IDs/accounts held with payment gateways/banks," agency added.

54.title: File report on commercial activities in residential areas: HC to BBMP
54.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has ordered Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to file a comprehensive report on commercial activities being carried out in residential areas. The court has given the civic body eight weeks to do so. This comes after Wilson Garden Residents Welfare Association moved the court seeking to restrict commercial activities in their locality.

55.title: SEBI bars Bombay Dyeing, Wadias from securities market, imposes ₹13.25 crore fine
55.article_body: Markets regulator SEBI has barred Bombay Dyeing and its promoters Nusli N Wadia, Ness Wadia and Jehangir Wadia from the securities market for two years for being involved in a fraudulent scheme of misrepresenting financial statements. The regulator has imposed a total monetary penalty of ₹13.25 crore on the company and the Wadias, directing them to pay within 45 days.

56.title: Sale of European strategic infrastructures to China was an error: Macron
56.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said the European Union has to re-think its trade dialogue with China. "We've made strategic errors in the past with the sale of infrastructures to China," Macron said at the end of a two-day EU summit on Friday. Separately, Finnish PM Sanna Marin said EU shouldn't be building strategic, critical dependency on authoritarian regimes like China.

57.title: My11Circle launches 'Har Din SUV Jito' T20 World Cup campaign
57.article_body: Fantasy cricket app My11Circle has launched 'Har Din SUV Jito' campaign featuring Saurav Ganguly. Trusted by 2.9 crore+ users, My11Circle allows users to use their cricket knowledge to create fantasy teams and win big rewards, shared the brand, adding that 100% real human players, unique app features, lower competition, and instant withdrawals make playing on My11Circle 100% safe and rewarding.

58.title: 5-year-old girl dies after over half dozen dogs attack her in MP's Khargone
58.article_body: A five-year-old girl was killed after half-a-dozen stray dogs attacked her in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone. Reports said that the girl received injuries on the neck and other parts of her body and died of excessive bleeding during treatment. The girl was going to a nearby shop to buy groceries when the incident took place.

59.title: India's forex reserves fall by $4.50 billion to $528.37 billion
59.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $4.50 billion to $528.37 billion for the week ending October 14, Reserve Bank of India data showed on Friday. The fall can be attributed to a decline in Foreign Currency Assets, which dropped $2.83 billion to $468.67 billion. In the previous week, the forex reserves had improved for the first time in 10 weeks.

60.title: Kidney patient waiting for dialysis dies as power goes off in UP hospital
60.article_body: A kidney patient who was waiting for his dialysis procedure died after power supply went off in a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha. While the patient was waiting for power supply till 2 pm, his condition deteriorated, reports said. The water supply to the dialysis unit was also cut due to power disruption.

61.title: S Korea arrests ex-Defence Min over 2020 killing by North Ko­rea
61.article_body: South Korea's former Defence Minister and Coast Guard Commissioner were arrested on Saturday over their alleged involvement in a cover-up related to North Korea's killing of a South Korean fisheries official in 2020. Arrest warrants were issued for ex-Defence Minister Suh Wook and ex-Coast Guard chief Kim Hong-hee over the risks of the suspects fleeing or destroying evidence.

62.title: Rajasthan revises pay scale of 31,473 contractual workers, gram panchayat assistants
62.article_body: Rajasthan government has revised the pay scale of around 31,473 contractual workers, gram panchayat assistants, education workers and para teachers, state Education Minister BD Kalla said. "They will now get a salary of ₹18,500 after nine years of service and ₹32,000 after 18 years of service," Kalla tweeted. Congress leader Harish Chaudhary called the revision a 'Diwali gift' for people.

63.title: Raju Srivastava's wife posts unseen video of him singing Kishore Kumar song, pens note
63.article_body: Raju Srivastava's wife Shikha has shared an unseen video of the late comedian singing Kishore Kumar's 'Yaadon Main Woh Sapnon Main Hai' song. "It's been a month since you're gone but we know you're still with us and will continue to be...I didn't know you would change this song into reality so soon (in just 12 days)," she wrote.

64.title: Delhi Metro's last trains on Diwali to start at 10 pm on all lines: DMRC
64.article_body: The last train on all lines of Delhi Metro will start at 10 pm on Diwali, Delhi Metro Rail Corporation Limited (DMRC) said. "On account of Diwali, the last Metro train service on Monday will start at 10:00 pm from terminal stations of all lines," it tweeted. "Metro trains will run as usual for rest of the day," DMRC added.

65.title: RBI allows Tamilnad Mercantile Bank to open new branches after 3 yrs
65.article_body: The RBI has lifted a three-year ban on Tamilnad Mercantile Bank's branch opening with effect from October 21, the lender said on Friday. This development comes after the Thoothukudi-based bank's shares were listed on the stock exchanges on September 15. Currently, it has 509 branches, of which 106 are rural, 247 are semi-urban, 80 are urban and 76 are metropolitan.

66.title: Replace Gandhi pic with Netaji's on currency notes: Hindu Mahasabha
66.article_body: Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha (ABHM) has demanded Mahatma Gandhi's photo from currency notes to be replaced with that of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. ABHM's Chandrachur Goswami said that it is the "best way to honour India's greatest freedom fighter Netaji". "We think Netaji's contribution to the country's freedom struggle was no less than that of Mahatma Gandhi," he added.

67.title: Extreme evil: French Prez after 12-yr-old girl murdered, body found in suitcase
67.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron called the murder of a 12-year-old girl, whose body was found in a suitcase outside her Paris home last week, an act of "extreme evil". Macron said the family of the girl, Lola, needed "the respect and affection of the nation". A 24-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder, rape and acts of torture.

68.title: Planning to open medical college, hospital in each district: Bihar CM
68.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar announced that the government is planning to open at least one medical college and hospital in each district. He also distributed appointment letters to 9,469 health employees in Patna. "The state health society will make another 11,000 new appointments in the coming years…More than 37,400 people have been appointed in the last five years," said Kumar.

69.title: NZ break record for scoring most runs in 1st over vs Australia in T20 WC history
69.article_body: New Zealand on Saturday broke the record for scoring most runs in the first over against Australia in T20 World Cup history. New Zealand scored 14 runs off the first over in the first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Australia. The over was bowled by Mitchell Starc, while New Zealand's Finn Allen aggregated all the runs.

70.title: Air India appoints Henry Donohoe as safety, security head
70.article_body: Air India has appointed Henry Donohoe as the head of its safety, security and quality functions with effect from November 7. Donohoe, an Irish national, started his career at Aer Lingus in 1978 and became its Chief Pilot. He then headed key departments including safety, quality, flight operations and engineering. He was also associated with Emirates for seven years.

71.title: MCG fines 9 people for illegally dumping garbage, 7 vehicles seized
71.article_body: To tackle the air pollution menace, the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) increased mechanical sweeping and sprinkling of recycled water on roads and at places where construction is underway. An MCG spokesperson said that fines were issued to nine people for keeping construction material uncovered and dumping garbage illegally. The body also seized seven vehicles for carrying mixed garbage.

72.title: Deutsche Bank cuts dozens of investment banking jobs globally: Report
72.article_body: Deutsche Bank has fired dozens of employees in investment banking division globally, Bloomberg reported. The job cuts were implemented across all levels, with focus on junior ranks. The step reportedly comes in line with efforts to keep costs low. Deutsche Bank fired more than 20 junior bank employees and some senior officials based in New York, New York Post reported.

73.title: No idea why people are bashing my wife: Hetmyer who was dropped from WC over missed flight
73.article_body: After West Indies crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022, batter Shimron Hetmyer, who was dropped from the squad over missed flight, wrote on his Instagram Stories, "I have no idea why people are bashing my wife about everything that I do." He added, "I do have a mind of my own and make my own decisions and choices."

74.title: Ex-Chinese Prez sitting next to Xi escorted out of meeting; video shows him confused
74.article_body: Former Chinese President Hu Jintao, the immediate predecessor of Xi Jinping, on Saturday was unexpectedly escorted out of the closing ceremony of a congress of the ruling Communist Party. The 79-year-old, who was seated next to Xi, was led off the stage by two men. The video of the incident shows Hu appearing to be confused while being escorted out.

75.title: PM Modi launches 'Rozgar Mela'; 75,000 youths get appointment letters
75.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday launched 'Rozgar Mela', the recruitment drive for 10 lakh youths, via video conferencing. Appointment letters to more than 75,000 youths were handed over during the ceremony. "As per the PM's directions, all ministries and departments are working towards filling up existing vacancies against sanctioned posts in 'mission mode'," the official press release said.

76.title: Side effects of biggest crisis in 100 years can't just go away in 100 days: PM Modi
76.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said, "The side effects of the biggest crisis in 100 years can't just go away in 100 days." Addressing the 'Rozgar Mela', he noted that many big economies of the world are struggling with inflation and unemployment. "Despite this, India has been trying to save itself from global crisis by taking new initiatives and risks," he added.

77.title: Software engineer out on bike ride gang-raped by 10 in Jharkhand; boyfriend beaten
77.article_body: A 26-year-old software engineer was allegedly gang-raped by around 10 men in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district, police said. The woman was out with her boyfriend on a bike on Thursday when the incident took place. The men thrashed her boyfriend and allegedly gang-raped her after taking her to a secluded area, police told PTI.

78.title: Elephant electrocuted to death in Assam, toll rises
78.article_body: An elephant was electrocuted to death after coming in contact with a live electric wire near the Napuk tea estate in the Charaideo district of Assam on Friday, said forest officials. Multiple elephant deaths have been reported in the state over the last few weeks. Earlier this month, an elephant died from electrocution in the Kokrajhar district.

79.title: Donald Trump summoned to testify before panel probing US Capitol riots
79.article_body: The House Select Committee investigating the US Capitol riots has summoned former US President Donald Trump, ordering him to testify under oath. Trump has been asked to produce documents detailing his communications before the riots. "We have assembled overwhelming evidence...that you personally orchestrated and oversaw...effort to overturn the 2020 presidential election," Committee told Trump.

80.title: 12-yr-old boy out to get chapatis for dad killed as BEST bus crushes him
80.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was killed after a Brihanmumbai Electric Supply & Transport Undertaking bus crushed him in Mumbai. Reports said that the boy was out to buy chapatis from a nearby hotel for his father when the incident took place. Reports added that the driver could not stop the vehicle in time and crushed the boy.

81.title: PM Modi announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia for families of deceased in Rewa accident
81.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakhs from Prime Minister's National Relief Fund (PMNRF) for the families of those who were killed in the bus accident in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa. PMO said that those injured in the accident would be given ₹50,000. As many as 15 people were killed in the incident while 40 others were injured.

82.title: US woman stabbed & buried alive by ex-husband, survives by using nose to remove soil
82.article_body: A 42-year-old woman who was allegedly stabbed and buried alive by former husband in US' Washington managed to survive by wiggling her nose in the soil to create pockets of space that allowed her to breathe, she said. The man has been arrested and charged with attempted murder, domestic violence/first-degree assault and kidnapping. The woman was rushed to a hospital.

83.title: ₹1,457 crore paid by Google India to its Ireland arm is not royalty, rules ITAT
83.article_body: The Bengaluru-bench of Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) ruled that payments totalling ₹1,457 crore made by Google India to Google Ireland is not a royalty and therefore, it is not subject to withholding tax. In its earlier order, the ITAT held that payments made by Google India between 2007-08 and 2012-13 are royalty and tax should be paid in India.

84.title: Facebook threatens to stop news sharing in Canada over revenue-sharing bill
84.article_body: Facebook has warned that it may block news sharing on its platform in Canada at a time when a legislation that compels digital platforms to pay news publishers for their content is under consideration. "The Online News Act misrepresents the relationship between platforms and news publishers," a Meta Canada official said. Facebook has not been invited to share its concerns.

85.title: Myanmar put on terror financing watchdog FATF's 'black list'
85.article_body: Global money laundering and terror financing watchdog Financial Action Task Force (FATF) has 'blacklisted' Myanmar for "continued lack of progress" by the military junta. The watchdog also called on member countries to apply enhanced due diligence to business relations and transactions in Myanmar. The FATF "black list" consists of just two other countries, Iran and North Korea.

86.title: Jio's Q2 net profit rises by 28% to ₹4,518 cr, revenue up 20%
86.article_body: Reliance Jio posted a 28% rise in net profit to ₹4,518 crore during the September quarter and on a sequential basis, the profit grew by 4%. Its revenue was reported at ₹22,521 crore, a 20% year-on-year increase. Sequentially, revenue increased by 3%. The average revenue per user (ARPU) at ₹177.2 per subscriber per month witnessed a 23.5% growth.

87.title: I am not playing WC, team has already left: Dhoni on cricket-related question at an event
87.article_body: A video has gone viral showing an interaction between an anchor and former India captain MS Dhoni at an event. The anchor can be heard saying, "If I don't ask you a World Cup question, [the audience] are gonna lynch me", to which Dhoni responds, "I'm not playing the World Cup...The team has already left."

88.title: Langur attends funeral of man who used to feed it, tries to wake him up; video viral
88.article_body: A video showing a langur attending the funeral of a man who used to feed it has gone viral on social media. In the video, the langur can be seen sitting near the body of the man and trying to wake him up. Several users who shared the clip said it has been shot in Sri Lanka's Batticaloa.

89.title: Vodafone Idea to issue ₹1,600 cr debentures to ATC Telecom to repay dues
89.article_body: The cash-strapped Vodafone Idea's (Vi) board on Friday approved the issuance of debentures worth ₹1,600 crore to ATC Telecom Infrastructure Private Limited. The telco will use the funds to repay dues to ATC Telecom, which stand at less than ₹2,000 crore. Vi said any funds remaining will be used for the company's "general corporate purposes".

90.title: Fire breaks out during refilling petroleum depot in Bhopal, 7 injured
90.article_body: A massive fire broke out during refilling at a petroleum depot in the Bakaniya area in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. As many as seven people were injured in the incident, police added. "All the injured persons have been admitted to a nearby private hospital," DCP Bhopal Vijay Khatri said. "Of those injured, four are in critical condition," Khatri added.

91.title: Airtel announces the launch of Airtel 5G Plus
91.article_body: Airtel has launched Airtel 5G Plus in a phased manner in Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Siliguri, Nagpur and Varanasi. It shared that customers can check if their area/ smartphone is 5G-enabled via Airtel Thanks App, adding that Airtel customers can switch to Airtel 5G Plus on their existing Airtel 4G SIMs.

92.title: Chemist, electrician returning from Chandigarh shop die as SUV hits scooter
92.article_body: A 35-year-old chemist, Suresh Kumar, and a 50-year-old electrician, Mahesh Chand, were killed after an SUV hit the scooter that they were travelling on in Chandigarh. The driver of the SUV has been arrested. The deceased were returning from Suresh's shop. Reports quoted sources as saying that the driver of the SUV was drunk.

93.title: AIMIM organises biryani fests in Madhya Pradesh to strengthen party
93.article_body: Ahead of the Madhya Pradesh Assembly elections in 2023, AIMIM launched its campaign by organising biryani fests to strengthen the party in the state. "Our [plan] is to make more than 10 lakh members of AIMIM before the Assembly elections. People are coming to Owaisi with enthusiasm...Hyderabadi Biryani is very famous after Owaisi in India," said AIMIM leader Peerzada Nizami.

94.title: Indian-origin man charged for killing his 11-yr-old son, 13-yr-old daughter in Canada
94.article_body: A 45-year-old Indian-origin Canadian man, Kamaljit Arora, has been charged with two counts of first-degree murder after his 11-year-old son and 13-year-old daughter were killed in their home in Montreal. He's also charged with one count of assault causing bodily harm for allegedly strangling his wife. Their neighbour said that the kids' elder sister had notified the police.

95.title: Viraj Ghelani orders pataka online, ends up getting Pataka Wraps: Faasos
95.article_body: Faasos shared that this Diwali, patakas aren't the only thing trending as its quirky activation idea got the netizens talking about its #PatakaWraps: Diwali-special wrap collection. Instagrammers like Viraj Ghelani, Nayandeep Rakshit posted about how their pataka order turned out to be exclusive bomb-tasting wraps, Faasos said, adding that the collection features some of its most loved wraps.

96.title: Delhi valet parking worker says i20 ran over feet, policeman's daughter booked
96.article_body: The Delhi Assistant Commissioner of Police's daughter has been booked after a valet parking assistant said that she ran over his feet with a car at a mall in Saket. "An i20...ran over my feet. My colleagues rushed me to hospital...I did not file the complaint earlier as I was waiting for my family members," victim said in an FIR.

97.title: MobiKwik's loss widens to ₹128 cr in FY22, revenue up 82%: Report
97.article_body: MobiKwik's parent company One MobiKwik Systems' consolidated revenue jumped 82.5% to ₹526.5 crore, while its consolidated loss was ₹128 crore in FY22 as compared to ₹111 crore a year ago, Moneycontrol reported citing regulatory filings. Total income jumped 80% to ₹543 crore and total expenses increased 61% to ₹652.5 crore. MobiKwik attained unicorn status in October 2021.

98.title: 'Red light on, Gaadi off' campaign from Oct 28 as Delhi AQI worsens
98.article_body: In a bid to curb vehicular pollution, the Delhi government will start its 'Red Light on, Gaadi off' campaign from October 28, said Environment Minister Gopal Rai. The city's Air Quality Index (AQI) on Friday plunged to 262, which falls in the 'poor' category. Experts believe toxic smog levels could increase after Diwali if the wind direction changes, added Rai.

99.title: UK Defence Secy opts out of PM race, suggests he would back Johnson
99.article_body: British Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Friday said he would not stand in the contest to replace Liz Truss as Prime Minister. "I feel that I can add the best value in keeping people safe at defence, by being the Defence Secretary," he added. Wallace also said he is "leaning towards" backing ex-PM Boris Johnson in the Tory leadership race.

100.title: Bengal teen kills self in police station after boy refuses to marry
100.article_body: An 18-year-old woman allegedly killed herself in the toilet of a police station in West Bengal's Uttar Dinajpur after a 17-year-old boy refused to marry her. "The two were reportedly in a relationship for six months," said an officer. The incident occurred after the woman created a ruckus outside the boy's house on Thursday. The boy was taken into custody.

101.title: No fine for violating traffic rules in Gujarat till Oct 27; violators to get flowers
101.article_body: Gujarat Home Minister Harsh Sanghavi has announced that no fine will be levied for traffic rule violations in the state from October 21 to 27 due to the festival of Diwali. "Don't use the decision to break the law. If someone breaks the rules, the Gujarat Police will persuade them not to, by giving flowers," he said in a video.

102.title: Woman claims L'Oreal hair products caused cancer, sues company in US
102.article_body: A woman in US has sued L'Oreal after claiming that she contracted uterine cancer after using chemical hair straightening products sold by L'Oreal USA. She said she had used the products for over two decades before being diagnosed and undergoing a full hysterectomy. This comes after a study established a link between usage of hair straightening products and uterine cancer.

103.title: SBI hikes interest rates on select fixed deposits by up to 80 bps
103.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) hiked interest rates on select fixed deposit (FD) tenures by up to 80 basis points. The new rates, which come into effect from October 22, will be applicable for FDs of less than ₹2 crore. The announcement comes days after SBI hiked the savings deposit rates by 30 bps for large accounts on October 18.

104.title: ﻿Synapsica﻿ fires 30% staff a month after CEO, COO arrested in ₹16-cr fraud case
104.article_body: Synapsica, a healthtech startup backed by Y Combinator, has laid off nearly 30% of its employees as part of a restructuring move, Co-founder Kuldeep Singh Chauhan confirmed. The layoffs come a month after the arrests of the company's CEO Meenakshi Singh and COO Dr Cherian. The siblings were arrested for allegedly duping Synapsica Co-founder Gandharv Goyal of around ₹16 crore.

105.title: US protects Ethiopian immigrants from deportation amid civil war
105.article_body: Citing the civil war in Ethiopia, the US on Friday announced that Ethiopians living in the country will get work permits and be shielded from deportation for 18 months. US Homeland Security Department said it was extending Temporary Protected Status to Ethiopians due to the "extraordinary and temporary conditions" that make it dangerous for them to return to their country.

106.title: 10 held for selling fake platelets as man dies after wrong platelets transfusion in UP
106.article_body: Ten gang members were arrested for allegedly selling fake platelets to patients in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. Police said the accused used to take plasma from different blood banks and put it in pouches. The action came after a man died after wrong platelets transfusion on October 17. His family claimed that the platelet was thin and made of mosambi juice.

107.title: Central Railway hikes platform ticket fare to ₹50 till Oct-end in Mumbai
107.article_body: Central Railway of Mumbai Division increased the price of platform tickets from ₹10 to ₹50 from Friday till October-end. The increased fare will be enforced only at Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus, Dadar, Thane, Kalyan, Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and Panvel stations, an official said. The decision was taken to curb the excessive rush of passengers amid the festive Diwali season.

108.title: India reports 2,112 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 24,043
108.article_body: India reported 2,112 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,119 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 24,043. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,957 following four casualties in the last 24 hours.

109.title: Noida Police arrests 2 for extortion by filming couple's hotel stay
109.article_body: Two persons have been arrested for trying to extort money from a couple by recording videos of their stay at a hotel, said Noida Police. According to police, the accused stayed in the same hotel room a few days ago and installed a camera there. The police said the couple received their videos and were asked to pay money.

110.title: MCD allocates ₹40,000 per ward to increase street lights at Chhath ghats
110.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has allocated ₹40,000 per ward to increase street lighting facilities at around 500 Chhath ghats in the national capital. "The funds will be provided for two ghats per ward. The amount will be utilised for strengthening street lighting in and around Chhath Puja ghats," a corporation spokesperson said.

111.title: Advisory issued against scammers and 5G fraud in Maharashtra
111.article_body: The Maharashtra Police have recently issued an advisory against a new wave of scammers and they believe that the fraudsters might try to cheat citizens on the pretext of providing 5G services. "Citizens are being warned not to fall prey to such calls and messages and we appeal to them not to share their details," said the advisory.

112.title: Viral video shows groom wearing gigantic garland of notes in Pak; people call him 'UFO'
112.article_body: A video showing a groom wearing a gigantic garland of currency notes in Pakistan has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the video, social media users wrote, "He looks like UFO," and, "This looks like a bed cover." Many users called it a "show off", with one saying, "I'd rather have it in an envelope."

113.title: 2 arrested for attacking Hyd petrol pump, scaring staff with toy gun
113.article_body: Two persons have been arrested for allegedly attacking a petrol pump in Hyderabad on October 17. The accused reportedly used a toy gun and a knife to scare the staff and broke the window and furniture of the petrol pump's office. They are also said to have hurt the employees and the owner of the petrol pump.

114.title: Mumbai twins cured of thalassemia as 9-yr-old brother donates bone marrow
114.article_body: Swarali and Swaranjali, 12-year-old twin sisters, who were suffering from thalassemia, have been cured of the blood disorder after their nine-year-old brother, Raj Jadhav, donated his bone marrow for their treatment. "I...told him it would be very painful. It took us six months to arrange funds for the transplants and prepare him mentally," said their father.

115.title: White House in talks with Musk to set up Starlink in Iran: Report
115.article_body: The White House is in talks with SpaceX CEO Elon Musk about setting up his company's satellite internet service Starlink in Iran, CNN reported citing multiple officials. Iran imposed internet restrictions after death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in police custody last month sparked nationwide protests. The US Treasury Department earlier eased some sanctions to help Iranians access internet.

116.title: Reliance to demerge financial services business, list it on stock exchanges
116.article_body: Reliance Industries has announced the demerger of its financial services business into a separate entity and the subsequent listing of the same on stock exchanges. The Mukesh Ambani-led company will demerge Reliance Strategic Investments and the resulting entity will be named Jio Financial Services. This will be done through a share-swap arrangement and no cash will be involved, Reliance said.

117.title: Apple's top hardware designer to leave 3 years after replacing Jony Ive
117.article_body: Apple's VP of industrial design Evans Hankey will leave the company after being in the role for three years. She took over the role in 2019 after the departure of Jony Ive, Apple's former design chief who worked with the company for two decades. Hankey will reportedly remain at Apple for the next six months to help with the transition.

118.title: Notice sent to medical college after video of girl dancing & rapping goes viral in Pakistan
118.article_body: A notice was issued to a medical college in Pakistan's Peshawar after a video of a girl rapping and dancing on stage during an event went viral on social media. The letter called the incident "unethical and immoral". "You are therefore directed to explain your position within three days positively, otherwise strict disciplinary action will be initiated," the letter stated.

119.title: Moody's lowers UK's outlook to 'negative' over political turmoil
119.article_body: Rating agency Moody's, on Friday, lowered the UK's outlook to 'negative' from 'stable' over the ongoing political turmoil following PM Liz Truss' resignation on Thursday. Moody's maintained its sovereign rating at 'Aa3' and said there was "heightened unpredictability in policymaking amid weaker growth prospects and high inflation". It also said there were "risks to the UK's debt affordability".

120.title: Russia not interested in ending Ukraine aggression: US
120.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said there is no evidence at the moment that Russia is "actually interested in stopping the [Ukraine] aggression". "On the contrary, we see Russia...tripling down on its aggression: in the last month, the mobilisation of hundreds of thousands of Russians; horrifically, cannon fodder that [Vladimir] Putin is trying to throw into the war," he added.

121.title: PCMC stays move over waste collection from big societies from Nov 1
121.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) on Friday stayed its decision not to collect wet waste from big housing societies from November 1. "At the same time, we will continue to hold positive engagement to convince them about processing the wet waste at their premises under the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016," Municipal Commissioner Shekhar Singh said.

122.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 absconders evading arrest for 24 years from Bihar
122.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two men who had been evading arrest for 24 years in connection with a murder case from Bihar. "Our team...was regularly working to nab these proclaimed offenders. On Thursday, secret input was received about them," DCP (South) Chandan Choudhary said. One of the accused was absconding after his release on court bail in 1999.

123.title: Mumbai woman looking to buy appliances via Facebook ad cheated of ₹2.07 lakh
123.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was cheated of ₹2.07 lakh after being promised air conditioner and washing machine through Facebook advertisement. The man, who claimed to be a Navy official said he would sell the appliances to her for ₹15,000. However, three men cheated her of ₹2.07 lakh under pretext of failed transactions. She was even asked for money for airport clearance.

124.title: 12 flyers injured, suffer broken nose as turbulence hits Spain flight; pic surfaces
124.article_body: Twelve passengers were injured after an Aerolíneas Argentinas flight from Spain to Argentina carrying 271 people was hit by severe turbulence, the airline said. A passenger is said to have suffered a broken nose, while a picture showed a passenger on a wheelchair with head injury. The airline said that three passengers were moved to a hospital.

125.title: ED seizes ₹78 crore during raids in B'luru in Chinese loan apps case
125.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate conducted raids at five locations in Bengaluru in the Chinese loan apps case and seized ₹78 crore. It also searched premises of payment gateway Razorpay, a spokesperson of which said the company cooperated with the agency and its funds were not seized. These apps are operated by Chinese nationals using forged documents of Indians, said the ED.

126.title: Rishi Sunak qualifies for UK PM race, 1st to get support of over 100 MPs
126.article_body: British Conservative politician Rishi Sunak has reached the minimum nomination threshold to enter the race to be the next party leader and Prime Minister. The ex-Finance Minister is the first contender to receive support of at least 100 Tory MPs. Sunak will automatically become party leader and Prime Minister if others fail to win 100 nominations from fellow Tory MPs.

127.title: Hyderabad Metro bans travelling with firecrackers ahead of Diwali
127.article_body: Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited (HMRL) has prohibited its passengers from travelling with firecrackers ahead of Diwali. It has put up posters at various stations for it. According to officials, carrying such objects could endanger the safety of everyone using the metro system, including the staff and the public. Violators won't be allowed to ride the train, said officials.

128.title: India reacts after Pakistan removed from terror financing watchdog's grey list
128.article_body: After Pakistan was removed from global terror finance watchdog FATF's grey list, India said, "As a result of FATF scrutiny, Pakistan has been forced to take some action against well-known terrorists." "It is in global interest that the world remains clear that Pakistan must continue to take credible, verifiable, irreversible and sustained action against terrorism," India further said.

129.title: When and at what time will India's T20 World Cup 2022 matches take place?
129.article_body: India will face Pakistan in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match on October 23. India will face Netherlands, South Africa, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe on October 27, 30, November 2 and 6, respectively. India's matches against Pakistan, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe will begin at 1.30 pm. India's matches against Netherlands and SA will begin at 12.30 pm and 4.30 pm, respectively.

130.title: 14 killed, 40 injured as bus travelling from Hyd to UP collides with trolley in MP
130.article_body: As many as 14 persons were killed and 40 others were injured in a collision between a bus and trolley near Suhagi Pahari in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa, police said. "Of the 40 injured, 20 (have been) admitted to a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj," Rewa SP Navneet Bhasin said. "Bus was going from Hyderabad to Gorakhpur," Bhasin added.

131.title: JugJugg Jeeyo premieres tonight, 8 pm on Colors Cineplex
131.article_body: JugJugg Jeeyo, one of the year's most successful movies as per Bollywood Hungama, will have its world television premiere on Colors Cineplex. The movie boasts a stellar star cast including Anil Kapoor, Neetu Kapoor, Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Prajakta Koli, and Maniesh Paul who come together to make your Diwali more 'lit' on Colors Cineplex, said the brand.

132.title: Viraj Ghelani orders pataka online, ends up getting Pataka Wraps: Faasos
132.article_body: Faasos shared that this Diwali, patakas aren't the only thing trending as its quirky activation idea got the netizens talking about its #PatakaWraps: Diwali-special wrap collection. Instagrammers like Viraj Ghelani, Nayandeep Rakshit posted about how their pataka order turned out to be exclusive bomb-tasting wraps, Faasos said, adding that the collection features some of its most loved wraps.

133.title: Tamil Nadu logs 222 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
133.article_body: Tamil Nadu recorded 222 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the State Health Department informed on Friday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the state. Tamil Nadu's active case count stood at 3,504, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Chennai logged 55 new cases, the highest among all districts in the state.

134.title: UN Security Council approves sanctions against Haitian gang leader
134.article_body: UN Security Council on Friday unanimously passed a sanctions resolution targeting Haitian gang leader Jimmy Cherizier. It also established a committee that can impose sanctions on other Haitians and groups whose actions threaten Haiti's peace and stability. The sanctions regime will allow the UN to impose an asset freeze, travel ban and arms embargo against anyone supporting criminal activities.

135.title: Anurag Thakur breaks down while addressing BJP workers in Himachal
135.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur broke down on Friday while addressing BJP workers at an election meeting in Sujanpur, Himachal Pradesh. He got emotional while talking about the support he has received from the people of his hometown, Hamirpur. The BJP leader also recalled his father ex-CM Prem Kumar Dhumal's interactions with workers. A video showed Thakur constantly wiping his eyes.

136.title: Outstanding from Zimbabwe in their return to World Cup action: Bishop
136.article_body: Ian Bishop praised Zimbabwe after the team reached their maiden Super 12 stage in T20 World Cup on Friday. "Outstanding from Zimbabwe in their return to World Cup action. Bowling group was outstanding. And once again Sikandar Raza getting just rewards for an outstanding year," tweeted Bishop. Zimbabwe beat Scotland by five wickets in their final Group B match.

137.title: Italy's Giorgia Meloni formally asks Prez for mandate to govern
137.article_body: Italian politician Giorgia Meloni on Friday said she and her allies have asked President Sergio Mattarella to give her the mandate to form Italy's next government. On the day, Meloni and her allies met Mattarella at the Quirinal presidential palace. Later, the palace said that Mattarella had summoned Meloni back to meet him in the afternoon on Friday.

138.title: Funeral organised for monkeys who died due to electrocution in Bihar
138.article_body: Locals on Thursday organised a funeral for two monkeys who died due to electrocution after being hit by a high-tension wire near a Hanuman temple in Bihar's Gaya. The funeral procession was reportedly taken out from the temple following several Hindu rituals, amid the beating of drums. The monkeys were cremated at a crematorium on the banks of Falgu river.

139.title: Indian duo of Rankireddy-Shetty crashes out of Denmark Open 2022
139.article_body: Indian men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty crashed out of the Denmark Open 2022 on Friday. The seventh seeds, who won the Commonwealth Games 2022 men's doubles gold medal, lost to world champions Aaron Chia and Soh Wooi Yik 16-21, 19-21 in the quarter-final. Rankireddy and Shetty lost the match in 41 minutes.

140.title: Anderlecht fans banned from attending club's next two away games
140.article_body: UEFA has banned Belgian club Anderlecht fans from attending the team's next two away matches after crowd trouble during their match against West Ham United last week. UEFA's ban comes after supporters indulged in "lighting of fireworks, throwing of objects, acts of damage and crowd disturbances". The club has also been fined €50,000 by the governing body.

141.title: Ex-Donald Trump advisor Steve Bannon sentenced to 4 months in jail
141.article_body: Former White House advisor Steve Bannon on Friday was sentenced to four months in prison on two counts of contempt. The US federal judge further ordered the former advisor to Donald Trump to pay $6,500 as fine. The two counts of contempt are for refusing to provide documents and testifying in the investigation of the January 6, 2021 Capitol riots.

142.title: Hundreds of civilians killed in Ethiopian civil war: Report
142.article_body: Hundreds of civilians were killed and dozens of women and girls were raped during the civil war in Ethiopia's Tigray region, The Associated Press reported citing an official document. The document is prepared by Tigray's regional Emergency Coordination Centre, which includes UN agencies, and government bureaus. The document does not mention any particular timeframe for the atrocities.

143.title: Man Utd likely to release Ronaldo in January transfer window: Report
143.article_body: Manchester United are reportedly going to release forward Cristiano Ronaldo from his contract in the January transfer window. This comes after Ronaldo was dropped from the squad for United's match against Chelsea after he refused to come on as a substitute against Tottenham and reportedly walked out of the stadium. Ronaldo said the "heat of the moment" got to him.

144.title: Chad government suspends 7 Opposition political parties
144.article_body: The Chad government on Friday suspended seven Opposition political parties, a day after anti-government protests led to violent clashes with security forces. Opposition leader Succes MASRA said the headquarter of his Les Transformateurs party was "being ransacked by security forces who forced their way in". The clashes on Thursday resulted in the death of over 60 people.

145.title: Tough penalties needed in F1 to protect sport's integrity: Hamilton
145.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton called for a strict penalty for the sport's cost cap breaches and said a "slap on the wrist" would not protect F1's integrity. "I want to give them the benefit of the doubt," he said. Hamilton said he hoped the right decisions would be made in dealing with Red Bull's 2021 cost cap infringement.

146.title: Erdogan to meet Swedish PM to discuss extraditions, NATO bid
146.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Thursday said he will meet Sweden's newly-elected PM, Ulf Kristersson, to discuss Stockholm's NATO membership bid as well as the extradition of individuals with alleged terror links to Turkey. Ankara has threatened to veto the NATO membership bids of Sweden and Finland if the countries refuse to extradite individuals whom Turkey deems terrorists.

147.title: 5 injured as Baroda women's cricket team bus collides with truck in Vizag, pic surfaces
147.article_body: Four players and team manager got injured after Baroda women's cricket team bus met with an accident in Visakhapatnam. The accident occurred when the bus collided with a truck. A picture has surfaced online showing damage caused to the bus. The injured were admitted to a private hospital and later discharged.

148.title: Ashwin on top, peerless in Test cricket not in T20s: Muralitharan
148.article_body: Former Sri Lanka off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan said India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin is "on top" in Test cricket and "there isn't much competition". "He is peerless," said Muralitharan, adding that there is a lot of competition in T20s and that is why Ashwin is not a confirmed starter in the format. Ashwin has taken 66 wickets in 59 T20Is.

149.title: J&K stone pelters are now participating in democracy: Amit Shah
149.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said youths who earlier pelted stones at security forces in Jammu and Kashmir are now participating in the region's development through elected offices. "There has been a positive change in the internal security of the country," he said. Shah was speaking on the occasion of the Police Commemoration Day.

150.title: Thorough post-mortem will be carried out: Cricket West Indies President after T20 WC exit
150.article_body: After West Indies crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022 in first round, Cricket West Indies President Ricky Skerritt stated, "I want to assure stakeholders that a thorough postmortem will be carried out on all aspects of our...preparation and performance." He added, "Solutions will be found in keeping with CWl's strategy to improve...quality and sustainability of cricket on all fronts."

151.title: 4 bodies found after Army helicopter carrying 5 crashes in Arunachal
151.article_body: Bodies of four persons have been recovered from the site after an Indian Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang district on Friday morning. "A total of five personnel were on board," a Defence spokesperson said in a statement. The statement added that the cause of the crash is not yet known and details are being ascertained.

152.title: Shocked: Stubbs on Halep's provisional suspension for doping
152.article_body: Ex-world number one doubles player Rennae Stubbs took to Twitter following the provisional suspension of two-time Grand Slam champion Simona Halep and wrote, "Shocked with this Simona Halep news." "I'll reserve my thoughts until she has gone through the process of investigating...how it happened and...ended up in her system," she added. Halep has tested positive for banned substance roxadustat.

153.title: Angry over burnt turtle curry, man kills wife in Odisha, buries body in backyard
153.article_body: A 36-year-old man allegedly killed his wife after an argument over burnt turtle curry in Odisha's Sambalpur. He buried her body in the backyard of his house and claimed that she went missing. A month back, the accused had illegally brought a turtle to his house and asked his wife to cook it. But it got slightly burnt while cooking.

154.title: Barclay, Khwaja set to contest again in ICC Chairman polls: Reports
154.article_body: Current ICC Chairman Greg Barclay and his deputy Imran Khwaja will reportedly contest each other yet again for the International Cricket Council (ICC) Chairman position. According to ESPNCricinfo, Khwaja will be nominated for the Chairman elections scheduled to take place at ICC's meeting in Melbourne next month. Notably, Khwaja is a former President of the Singapore Cricket Association.

155.title: BJP, RSS have spread hatred and violence everywhere: Rahul Gandhi
155.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Karnataka on Friday, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi accused the BJP and Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) of spreading hatred and violence everywhere in the country. "This country is not the country of hatred and violence...They won't benefit this country in any way," the 52-year-old added. He further accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of imposing "wrong GST".

156.title: TN fisherman hurt after Navy fires 'warning shots', CM Stalin writes to PM
156.article_body: A fisherman in Tamil Nadu sustained injuries after the Navy "fired warning shots" in mid-sea on Friday. Following the incident, CM MK Stalin wrote to PM Narendra Modi, urging him to direct the armed forces to "exercise extreme caution and restraint". "You are well aware of the plight of Indian fishermen being ill-treated by Sri Lankan security forces," Stalin added.

157.title: 'Dream...' release date changed to avoid clash with 'Satyaprem...': Reports
157.article_body: Ekta Kapoor has reportedly changed the release date of 'Dream Girl 2' to avoid a box-office clash with 'Satyaprem Ki Katha'. 'Dream Girl 2', which was set to release on June 29, will reportedly arrive in theatres on June 23. 'Dream Girl 2' will feature Ayushmann Khurrana and Ananya Panday. 'Satyaprem Ki Katha' will star Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani.

158.title: Nobody can explain what Super 12 qualification means to Zimbabwe: Ervine
158.article_body: Zimbabwe captain Craig Ervine said nobody can explain what his side's first-ever T20 World Cup Super 12 qualification means to the team. "Had the whole country behind us and well deserved for the boys to get through...The support for us has been special. The support in Townsville was incredible," he added. Zimbabwe will face South Africa in Super 12 stage.

159.title: Jharkhand govt to open 100 schools for farmers to help maximise profit
159.article_body: The Jharkhand government will open 100 kisan pathshalas (schools for farmers) to provide training and other aid to help them maximise profit, CM Hemant Soren said. Inaugurating the first such facility in Khunti, Soren said, "Around 80% of...state's population is dependent on agriculture."  These schools would provide consultancy to farmers about alternate cropping and usage of modern technology.

160.title: Cameron Green gives a little bit better balance to squad: Finch
160.article_body: After Australian all-rounder Cameron Green was included in the place of injured Josh Inglis in the T20 World Cup squad, skipper Aaron Finch said that Green gives a little bit better balance to the squad. "We're taking the risk and not going with the extra keeper, which obviously has a degree of risk to it," Finch said.

161.title: CDS General Anil Chauhan, 3 service chiefs visit NDA
161.article_body: Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Anil Chauhan, accompanied by Chiefs of the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force, visited the National Defence Academy (NDA) in Pune on Friday, an official said. The CDS and the three service chiefs paid homage to martyrs at the Hut of Remembrance, a statement said. General Chauhan also reviewed training at the NDA.

162.title: Previous govts neglected centres of faith: PM Modi in Uttarakhand
162.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday accused previous governments of leaving centres of faith across the country in a state of neglect. These places are now being restored to their lost glory, he said. Addressing a gathering in Uttarakhand, he said, "Pride in our own legacy and every possible effort for development are the foundations of a 21st century India."

163.title: DMK suspends party leader who mocked Congress Prez Kharge on Twitter
163.article_body: The DMK has suspended spokesperson KS Radhakrishnan from the party a day after he reportedly mocked Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Twitter. Radhakrishnan is said to have shared a meme that described Kharge as 'Manmohan Singh 2.0'. DMK announced that Radhakrishnan has been suspended for "violating party discipline and engaging in acts that bring disrepute to the party".

164.title: I consider him my brother: Tom on his bond with 'Harry Potter' co-star Daniel
164.article_body: Talking about his bond with his 'Harry Potter' co-star Daniel Radcliffe, Tom Felton said, "I love the man dearly." "I don't see him as much as I'd like to - that's the same for all of us, really. But I consider him a brother, definitely. Huge amounts of respect for him," he added. Tom played Draco Malfoy in the franchise.

165.title: Will be barefoot till roads mended in Gwalior: MP minister Tomar
165.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Energy Minister Pradhuman Singh Tomar has vowed to remain barefoot till the condition of roads in Gwalior Assembly constituency gets improved. While inspecting roads in his constituency, the BJP leader apologised to people for poor roads. "When I walk barefoot, I'll feel the pain of pebbles and bad roads. I'll realise the trouble of the public," he added.

166.title: Gas price may reach ₹2,000/cylinder if PM Modi elected again: Kishor
166.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor criticised PM Narendra Modi over issues like price rise and lack of industrial development in Bihar. "If he (PM Modi) gets elected for yet another term in office, the price (of cooking gas) may reach ₹2,000 per cylinder," said Kishor. He added that workers from Bihar are still going to Gujarat to work in factories.

167.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states for next few days, list released
167.article_body: The IMD issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs for next few days. It's very likely over Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Kerala on October 22 and 23. Odisha may witness it from October 23 to 25. It's likely over West Bengal, Assam, Meghalaya and other north eastern states on October 24 and 25.

168.title: PM Modi frequently visits Guj as all's not well with BJP: Congress
168.article_body: Congress leader Raghu Sharma claimed "all is not well with the BJP" in Gujarat and that is why PM Narendra Modi was making frequent visits to the state. "There is a lot of anger among the people, especially tribals, against the ruling BJP in the state," said Sharma. He added that AAP is functioning as a 'B-team' of the BJP.

169.title: Remains of world's fastest dinosaur that resembled ostrich discovered
169.article_body: Researchers in North America have discovered the remains of the world's fastest dinosaur, the ornithomimosaur. The dinosaur that lived between 145 million and 66 million years ago was said to be like "ostriches or emus" in the food web. It had large eyes, long arms with relatively large, clawed hands, long legs and tail, and either small or no teeth.

170.title: UP CM announces monthly motorcycle allowance of ₹500 for police
170.article_body: CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday announced a monthly motorcycle allowance of ₹500 for all non-gazetted police personnel in Uttar Pradesh. Earlier, the cycle allowance for state policemen was ₹200. The CM also announced that the state government will link police personnel with an e-pension portal. Further, head constables and constables of police will be paid ₹2,000 annually as phone allowance.

171.title: 'Minnal Murali' director Basil in talks to helm 'Shaktimaan' film: Report
171.article_body: Director Basil Joseph is reportedly in talks to direct the film adaptation of Mukesh Khanna-starrer superhero show 'Shaktimaan'. Basil, who works in the Malayalam film industry, is known for directing the Tovino Thomas-starrer superhero movie 'Minnal Murali'. According to reports, actor Ranveer Singh is being considered to play the lead role in the forthcoming project.

172.title: 3 members of banned PFI, 1 linkman arrested from Assam's Kamrup
172.article_body: Three members of the banned organisation Popular Front of India (PFI) along with a linkman were arrested in Assam's Kamrup district on Friday, officials said. The arrested individuals were identified as Nazrul Islam, Hafizur Rahman, Rafiqul Islam and Mominur Islam. Mominur Islam, an alleged linkman of the PFI, hails from Chhaygaon area, while the rest are residents of Nagarbera.

173.title: 51 cartons of illegal liquor seized from UP school's kitchen store
173.article_body: In UP's Kushinagar, police recovered 51 cartons of illicit liquor from the kitchen store of a government school after a student found the stash and raised an alarm. A teacher reportedly said that part of the kitchen is usually closed and the keys were with the village head. Police are probing a nexus between school staff and the liquor mafia.

174.title: Corruption claims in Ujjain temple construction worrying: Kamal Nath
174.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath said allegations of corruption in the construction of 'Mahakal Lok' in Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar temple are "worrying".
