"Sentiments of crores of people have been hurt...There should be an impartial, high-level inquiry," said Nath. Earlier, the state Congress had alleged corruption in the arrangements of food and water for the crowds during the Mahakal corridor inauguration.

175.title: Odisha man sentenced to 25-yr jail for raping 5-yr-old girl
175.article_body: A court in Odisha's Kandhamal district sentenced a 42-year-old man to 25 years of imprisonment for raping a five-year-old girl. The court directed the District Legal Services Authority to grant a compensation of ₹6 lakh to the rape survivor. Also, judge Sanjiv Behera imposed a fine of ₹25,000 on convict Nileswar Pradhan. Notably, the incident happened in October 2020.

176.title: Need to equip police with sophisticated weapons: K'taka CM Bommai
176.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "destructive forces are trying to disturb peace" and his government would strengthen the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) to counter it. He added that the state proposes to undertake more police reforms and there is a need to equip police personnel with sophisticated weapons. Bommai said the government would increase the number of prisons in the state.

177.title: 2 children found dead on migrant boat off Italian coast
177.article_body: Two children were found dead on a migrant boat off the southern coast of Italy on Friday, the Italian Coast Guard said in a statement. Some 38 migrants were rescued from the boat, the Coast Guard informed. A Tunisian fishing vessel, which first came to the migrants' aid, reported an explosion onboard the migrant boat, as per the Coast Guard.

178.title: Shruti Haasan to star in international movie 'The Eye'
178.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan has signed on to star in an international feature film 'The Eye', which will be directed by Daphne Schmon. The psychological thriller will feature actor Mark Rowley of 'The Last Kingdom' fame opposite Shruti. Sharing the news on her Instagram handle, Shruti wrote, "Super stoked to be a part of 'The Eye' with the loveliest team!!!"

179.title: Rematch of 2021 final: Southee on NZ playing Aus in their T20 WC 2022 opener
179.article_body: New Zealand fast bowler Tim Southee said his side's T20 World Cup 2022 opener against defending champions Australia is a rematch of last year's final. "To play against Australia at...SCG (Sydney Cricket Ground) in front of a sold-out crowd is a pretty good way to start the tournament," he added. The Super 12 stage match will be played on Saturday.

180.title: President Murmu to embark on 2-day visit to Mizoram from Nov 3
180.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu will embark on a two-day visit to Mizoram from November 3 and address the state Assembly, an official said on Friday. She will attend the convocation of Mizoram University (MZU) and inaugurate facilities after her arrival on November 3, the official added. This will be the President's first visit to the state since assuming office in July.

181.title: Indian Navy intercepts suspicious boat in Palk Bay
181.article_body: An Indian Navy vessel intercepted a suspicious boat in Palk Bay, near the India-Sri Lanka International Maritime Boundary Line on Friday. As the boat did not halt despite warning messages, the Navy ship fired warning shots. According to reports, a crew member of the 'suspicious' boat received injuries in the firing and was flown to a government hospital in Ramanathapuram.

182.title: Massive traffic jam on Delhi-Gurugram expressway before Diwali, ambulance gets stuck
182.article_body: A video, shot at the Sarhaul border on Delhi-Gurugram expressway, shows massive traffic jam ahead of the festival of Diwali. An ambulance also got stuck in the massive traffic jam. To avoid congestion, Delhi and Gurugram Traffic Police created designated parking sites and urged citizens to not park their vehicles at any other location.

183.title: Humbling, emotional: Raza on Zimbabwe's 1st-ever T20 WC Super 12 qualification
183.article_body: After Zimbabwe qualified for the Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup for the first time on Friday, all-rounder Sikandar Raza said it's a "humbling" and "emotional" moment. Zimbabwe beat Scotland by five wickets in their third and final Group B match. Raza was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 23-ball 40 and bowling figures of 4-0-20-1.

184.title: Will move SC to increase reservation for tribals: Chhattisgarh CM
184.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday said soon his government will move the Supreme Court to increase the reservation for tribals in accordance with their population there. Baghel said his government has formed a commission in the matter and it will submit its report in November. Baghel spoke to reporters after inaugurating the Chhattisgarh Tribal Festival in New Delhi.

185.title: Hyd school ordered to be derecognised by T'gana govt over 4-yr-old's rape
185.article_body: Telangana Education Minister Sabitha Indra Reddy has ordered the cancellation of the government recognition granted to BSD DAV Public School in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills, where a four-year-old girl was allegedly raped by the principal's driver. Earlier, the accused driver and the principal were arrested by police and remanded in judicial custody following protests by the girl's parents.

186.title: Plea for survey of Gyanvapi underground areas to be heard on Nov 2
186.article_body: The Varanasi District Court on Friday said it will hear on November 2 a plea by Hindu plaintiffs for surveying two underground places in the Gyanvapi Mosque complex. The court imposed a penalty on the mosque committee as they did not file an objection to the survey in time. Meanwhile, a Hindu petitioner pleaded to ensure the safety of idols.

187.title: Minor siblings drown while playing in pond in Assam
187.article_body: Two minor siblings drowned while playing in a pond in Gopalpur village in Barpeta, Assam. The deceased were aged between 6-7 years. "We searched them (deceased) in the nearby areas but could not find them. Later, when we looked for them in the pond, we found their bodies," a relative of the deceased minors said.

188.title: BJP's Rajinder Sharma elected mayor of Jammu
188.article_body: BJP's Rajinder Sharma was elected mayor of the Jammu Municipal Corporation (JMC) on Friday, while his fellow party leader Baldev Singh Billoria was elected deputy mayor. The election was boycotted by Congress corporators over the "open ballot" voting process. Rajinder Sharma got 57 of the 59 votes cast for the mayor's post, whereas his rival from Congress received one vote.

189.title: Woman killed in border clash between Pak forces and Taliban
189.article_body: A woman was killed by Pakistani gunfire amid clashes between Pakistani border forces and the Taliban forces along the border in the Spin Boldak town in Afghanistan's Kandahar province, Khaama Press reported. The deceased was from the Afghan side of the border, a Taliban official said. Heavy weapons, including mortars, were used during the clashes, Khaama Press said citing sources.

190.title: Pakistan removed from terror financing watchdog FATF's grey list after 4 years
190.article_body: Pakistan was on Friday removed from the global terror finance watchdog Financial Action Task Force's (FATF's) grey list after four years and won't be subjected to "increased monitoring". FATF said it welcomed "Pakistan's significant progress in improving its AML/CFT (anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing) regime". Apart from Pakistan, Nicaragua was also removed from the grey list.

191.title: Victoria Governor hosts Team India at her official residence, shares pics
191.article_body: Victoria Governor Linda Dessau hosted Team India players and support staff at her official residence ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Pakistan in Melbourne. She took to her Twitter account to share pictures from the event. India will face Pakistan on October 23.

192.title: 3 men cleaning septic tank die after inhaling toxic gas at TN resort
192.article_body: Three men, including an 18-year-old, died of asphyxiation on Friday after inhaling toxic gas while cleaning a septic tank at a resort in Tamil Nadu, police said. The victims got exposed to toxic fumes of the sewer gas when they descended into the septic tank and fell into it, police added. Police have detained the resort's manager and contractor.

193.title: Who scored the most runs and who took most wickets in Round 1 of T20 World Cup 2022?
193.article_body: Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza top-scored in the Round 1 of T20 World Cup 2022 with 136 runs in three innings. He is followed by Netherlands' Max O'Dowd (129 runs) and Scotland's George Munsey (121 runs). Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga and Netherlands' Bas de Leede are the joint-highest wicket-takers in Round 1, with seven wickets each.

194.title: Ekta Kapoor urges govt to find Balaji Telefilms' former COO who went missing in Kenya
194.article_body: Producer Ekta Kapoor on Friday requested Indian government and humanitarian organisation Kenya Red Cross to help find Zulfiqar Ahmad Khan, former Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Balaji Telefilms. Khan went missing in Nairobi in the third week of July. Meanwhile, actor Karan Kundrra also took to Twitter and urged people to sign a petition to find the former Balaji COO.

195.title: Pot of coins dug up in Kuno park, Palpur royal descendant stakes claim
195.article_body: A pot of die-struck copper and silver coins was unearthed on Wednesday by workers digging inside Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, where PM Narendra Modi recently released eight cheetahs. The workers reportedly distributed the coins among themselves. Palpur royal family's descendent, RK Shreegopal Deo Singh Palpur, said the coins belong to his family. Palpur fortress is located in the park.

196.title: Halep releases statement after being suspended for doping, says 'Biggest shock of my life'
196.article_body: Former world number one women's tennis player Simona Halep has released a statement after being suspended for doping. Calling it "the biggest shock of my life", Halep said, "Facing such an unfair situation, I feel completely confused and betrayed." She added, "I will fight until the end to prove that I never knowingly took any prohibited substance."

197.title: Solicitor General made false claims for political motives: Chhattisgarh CM
197.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday said, "It is extremely unfortunate that a person...like Solicitor General [Tushar Mehta] is making false and mischievous allegations for political motives." The ED had earlier claimed that a judge had met Baghel two days before bail was granted to some accused in a money laundering case. "I have never met the judge," Baghel added.

198.title: BJP-led govt very unpopular among people of Himachal: Bhupesh Baghel
198.article_body: Ahead of Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh, senior observer of Congress for the state, Bhupesh Baghel, said that Jairam Thakur government has become very unpopular among the people. "There are issues like unemployment, inflation in the state and people have made up their minds about change," Baghel said. "I believe when results are declared, Congress will win there," he added.

199.title: I'd go with Shami: Moody on India's 3rd pacer ahead of T20 WC match vs Pak
199.article_body: Ahead of India-Pakistan Super 12 stage match in T20 World Cup 2022, Tom Moody said he'd pick Mohammad Shami as third pacer in India's playing XI. "He's a big player with a lot of experience," he added. "Obviously, Bhuvi (Bhuvneshwar Kumar)...Arshdeep Singh are the first two," stated Moody. Shami posted 3/4 in the last over against Australia in warm-up match.

200.title: 'Brahmastra' VFX team to work on Hrithik & Deepika's 'Fighter': Report
200.article_body: Double Negative (DNEG), the VFX company that worked on the visual effects of 'Brahmastra', has been roped in to work on the movie 'Fighter', according to a report. The upcoming movie is an aerial action thriller which will be directed by Siddharth Anand. 'Fighter', starring Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone, is set to release in theatres on September 28, 2023.

201.title: Such things happen: Parineeti on rejecting Ranbir's 'Animal' for Imtiaz's film
201.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra has opened up about opting out of Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Animal' for Imtiaz Ali's film. "These things happen, it is a part and parcel of life. We must make such choices every day. You make the choice that is right for you," she said. 'Animal' will also feature Rashmika Mandanna, Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol.

202.title: Major setback for Indian consumers: Google on being fined ₹1,338 crore in India
202.article_body: Google issued a statement a day after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) imposed a ₹1,338-crore fine on it for 'anti-competitive practices'. Saying that Android supports "thousands of businesses in India", Google called CCI's move "a major setback" for Indian consumers and businesses. The move opened "serious security risks" and raised the cost of mobile devices for Indians, it added.

203.title: Former world number one Simona Halep provisionally suspended for doping
203.article_body: Former world number one women's tennis player Simona Halep has been provisionally suspended for doping. The two-time Grand Slam champion tested positive for the banned substance roxadustat, the International Tennis Integrity Agency (ITIA) said on Friday. Halep was tested during US Open 2022 and both her A and B samples confirmed the presence of the drug.

204.title: WWE legend Kevin Nash's son Tristen Nash passes away aged 26
204.article_body: WWE Hall of Famer Kevin Nash's son Tristen Nash has passed away aged 26. Tristen, who was a musician and poet, was Kevin and Tamara McMichael's only child. The cause of his death hasn't been disclosed to public. Condoling Tristen's demise, Matt Hardy tweeted, "My thoughts are with Kevin & his family following the passing of his son...It's absolutely tragic."

205.title: Man caught with elephant ivory gets life sentence in Uganda
205.article_body: A Ugandan court has awarded life imprisonment to a man caught with nearly 10 kg of elephant ivory, the country's highest punishment ever for wildlife violations, authorities said on Friday. The convict was sentenced to life as he was found to be a "habitual offender", having served 18 months in jail for a similar offence earlier, Uganda Wildlife Authority informed.

206.title: Chennai Police launch mobile app to provide real-time traffic updates
206.article_body: Chennai Police Commissioner Shankar Jiwal on Thursday launched a mobile application, roadEase, to provide real-time updates on road closures and diversions, estimated travel times and alternative routes. "[The app] will be able to deploy the information on Google Maps within 15 minutes and the closed road will be shown with the dotted red line," a press release from police stated.

207.title: AIIMS Delhi withdraws order on SOPs for special medical treatment of MPs
207.article_body: Delhi's All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has withdrawn all Standard Operating Procedures issued for special medical treatment of MPs, with immediate effect. The order issued earlier was criticised by doctors, who called it "VIP culture". "A voice of reason, rationale and resolve can make a big difference," the Federation of Resident Doctors' Association (FORDA) said on Friday.

208.title: 65-yr-old woman drowns at TN home amid rains; 275 houses inundated
208.article_body: A 65-year-old woman, who was sleeping at her residence, drowned after water gushed into her house following heavy rainfall in Tamil Nadu's Erode district on Friday. Around 275 houses in various parts of the district were reportedly left inundated. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecasted heavy rainfall and thunderstorm in the state till October 23.

209.title: 30 people injured after tent collapses during science fair in Kerala
209.article_body: As many as 30 people, including students and teachers, were injured on Friday when a temporary tent put up as part of a science fair collapsed at a school in Kerala's Kasargod, police said. "The injured...have been shifted to various hospitals nearby in various ambulances and private vehicles," police said. "The shed wasn't strong enough," locals said.

210.title: ED freezes Bitcoins worth ₹7.12 crore in E-nuggets gaming app case
210.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has frozen Bitcoins worth ₹7.12 crore and seized ₹1.65 crore in cash as part of its probe in the E-nuggets gaming app case, officials said. The app was allegedly designed to defraud the public. "The ED carried out a search operation at two premises in Kolkata, leading to the seizure," the agency said in a statement.

211.title: 157 trees will be transplanted for 2 new blocks at IIT-D: CM Kejriwal
211.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said the proposal to construct two new academic blocks at the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT-D), which will require the transplantation of 157 trees, has been approved. As per plans, a new engineer block and a mini academic block will be constructed. "Our government will leave no stone unturned...for our students," Kejriwal said.

212.title: Broadcasters unwilling to pay what women's football deserves: FIFA
212.article_body: After FIFA rejected several bids for the 2023 Women's World Cup broadcast rights, the body's Chief Business Officer Romy Gai said that the bids did not reflect the popularity of women's football. "This is...[a] testament...of broadcasters [unwilling] to pay what the women's game deserves...The WC 2019...was a catalyst for change in terms of the TV audience," Gai said.

213.title: Pune Police arrests 6 people for stealing motorcycle silencers
213.article_body: The Crime Branch of Pune Police has arrested six people from Hadapsar in the Pune district for stealing motorcycle silencers. The accused allegedly extracted platinum dust from the silencers and sold it to jewellers. "We had been getting complaints related to theft of motorcycle silencers from Hadapsar, Uruli Devachi, Phursungi, Shewalwadi and Mundhwa areas," said Police Inspector Hemant Patil.

214.title: Rahul will interact with all sections of society during T'gana stay: Cong MP
214.article_body: Telangana Congress MP Uttam Kumar Reddy said Rahul Gandhi would interact with all sections of society during his stay in Telangana during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from October 23 to November 7. "Bharat Jodo Yatra has been receiving tremendous response from all sections of society," Reddy said. "This will be...more successful in Telangana compared to other states," he added.

215.title: Bengaluru to receive heavy rains & thunderstorms until October 23: IMD
215.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted thunderstorms and heavy rains in Bengaluru on October 22 and 23. The department has also issued a yellow alert in the city until Friday. According to IMD, Bengaluru received 60.5 mm of rain between Wednesday night and the early hours of Thursday, with Hampi Nagar ward receiving the most rainfall at 85.5 mm.

216.title: Bengaluru's Namma metro conducts trial run from Whitefield to ITPL
216.article_body: Bengaluru's Namma Metro started its trial run from Whitefield to ITPL on Friday. The stretch, which is part of the Purple line, witnessed a six-car train being operated along the route to check for structural obstructions. Notably, the Purple line will connect Mysore Road in the west to Whitefield in the east after it gets fully functional.

217.title: Man breaks Guinness World Record for 'farthest eyeball pop' in Brazil, pic viral
217.article_body: Sidney de Carvalho Mesquita has set the Guinness World Record for the farthest eyeball pop (male). Sidney made this record with a protrusion of 18.2 mm (0.71 inches) beyond his eye sockets. The record was verified in Sao Paulo, Brazil in January. The medical term for when an eyeball protrudes or "pops" out of the eye socket is 'globe luxation'.

218.title: Rusty country-made revolvers found abandoned at Hyd's Public Gardens
218.article_body: Rusty revolvers were found abandoned at Hyderabad's Public Gardens on Friday afternoon. The country-made revolvers were found by workers of Horticulture Department while they were cleaning the area. The workers alerted Saifabad Police, who recovered the weapons. "We suspect someone might have bought these weapons from other states and concealed [them] in the trees," Inspector K Sathaiah said.

219.title: Where have we reached in the name of religion?: SC on hate speeches
219.article_body: The Supreme Court, while hearing a plea against hate speeches, said, "Where have we reached in the name of religion? It is tragic." It said the statements of hate speech were "indeed disturbing", especially for India which is a democracy and religion-neutral. It issued notices to Delhi, Uttarakhand and UP governments to take suo motu cognisance of hate speech cases.

220.title: Consciously focusing on films, have taken break from OTT: Kirti Kulhari
220.article_body: Actress Kirti Kulhari said she has decided to take a break from OTT and focus on feature films. "I need to do something that really pushes me...I haven't really felt that coming in films for me," she said. "OTT...was doing so much for me...But this year I've consciously started focusing on films and...taken a little break from series," she added.

221.title: India successfully tests Agni Prime ballistic missile off Odisha coast
221.article_body: India successfully test-fired Agni Prime off the coast of Odisha on Friday. Defence officials said the new generation ballistic missile travelled its maximum range and the test established the accuracy and reliability of the system. Its performance was validated using data obtained by many range instrumentation, they added. It was the third consecutive successful test flight of the missile.

222.title: Allu Arjun's father announces film with 'Kantara' director-actor Rishab
222.article_body: Film producer Allu Aravind, father of actor Allu Arjun, has announced a film with Rishab Shetty, who wrote, directed and starred in the recently released movie 'Kantara'. "I've asked Rishab to do a film for Geetha Arts urgently, and he has immediately agreed," Aravind said at an event. 'Kantara' has grossed over ₹175 crore since its release on September 30.

223.title: Chhattisgarh CM meets Cong President-elect Kharge, extends wishes
223.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday met with the Congress President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge at his residence. Baghel tweeted that he greeted the President-elect and extended wishes to him. The newly elected President of the Indian National Congress, Mallikarjun Kharge, will take charge of the post on October 26 at All India Congress Committee (AICC) headquarters.

224.title: Over 20 ABVP activists try to storm Pragathi Bhavan in Hyd, arrested
224.article_body: Over 20 activists of Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) were arrested by Hyderabad Police for allegedly trying to storm Pragathi Bhavan, official residence of Telangana CM, on Friday. The activists were reportedly protesting against the hike in engineering fees in the state. The protesting activists were taken to Goshamahal Police Stadium where they were held as part of preventive custody.

225.title: It's a matter of pride to be the voice of Shri Ram: Sharad on 'Adipurush'
225.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar, who is set to voice actor Prabhas in the Hindi version of 'Adipurush', said, "For anyone in India, it's a matter of pride to be the voice of Shri Ram." Prabhas will portray Lord Ram in the upcoming movie. "I'm fortunate...to be...voice of Shri Ram and I got this chance, thanks to Om (Raut, director)," Sharad added.

226.title: Delhi's PM2.5 level for Jul-Aug-Sep quarter 2nd lowest in 5 yrs: CSE
226.article_body: This year Delhi's pollution average of PM2.5 for the July-August-September quarter was the second lowest in five years, the Centre for Science and Environment (CSE) said. The PM2.5 average in 2022 for this quarter was 37 microgram per cubic metre (Mg/M3). In the same quarter in 2020, the PM2.5 average was 36 Mg/M3.

227.title: Pune civic body disqualifies recruitment of 672 new employees
227.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar has disqualified the recruitment of 672 new employees of the civic body. The government found that these recruitments were made fraudulently. The termination orders were given after Divisional Commissioner Saurabh Rao's enquiry report was submitted. Reportedly, many recruitments were made in exchange for large amounts of money.

228.title: He can win T20 World Cup on his own: Watson on Hardik Pandya
228.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya, former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said the India all-rounder can win the T20 World Cup on his own. "He's not just a finisher, he's a power hitter too. He's got all the skills...He's truly a match-winner," he added. India will face Pakistan in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022 at Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday.

229.title: Incredible stuff: Jaffer on Ireland qualifying for Super 12s of T20 WC 2022
229.article_body: Reacting to Ireland qualifying for Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Incredible stuff Ireland, congratulations on making...Super 12s." He added, "Can't help but feel sad for West Indies though. [T20 World Cup] won't be the same without the Caribbean flavour." Meanwhile, Robin Uthappa tweeted, "Well done Ireland...Gotta feel for West Indies cricket though."

230.title: Real estate agent shot at by unidentified men at Thane petrol pump
230.article_body: A real estate agent was allegedly shot at by unidentified men at a petrol pump in Thane's Naupada. "Initially, it was noticed that the attack happened due to a property dispute but the probe is on," said the police, adding that the crime branch is parallelly looking into the matter. The victim was with colleagues when the attack took place.

231.title: It means everything: Ireland captain on reaching Super 12 stage in T20 WC
231.article_body: After Ireland's nine-wicket win over West Indies in Group B match clinched their place in the Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022, Ireland captain Andy Balbirnie said, "It means everything." He added, "We had a really disappointing loss last year at...same stage and we did a lot of thinking...It's just a really proud day to be Irish."

232.title: Man killed after JCB hits auto-rickshaw in Mumbai's Bandra
232.article_body: A 52-year-old man was killed after the auto-rickshaw he was travelling in was hit by a JCB machine from the side in Mumbai's Bandra. The JCB was reportedly stationed in the middle of the road and took a sudden reverse turn because of which it hit the rickshaw. The 22-year-old machine driver has been arrested.

233.title: Actress Vaishali Takkar's eyes donated before her cremation
233.article_body: Actress Vaishali Takkar's family donated her eyes before she was cremated on October 16. "Vaishali loved her eyes and often used to say that she would like to donate her eyes after her death,"  her cousin told India Today. The TV actress died by suicide at her residence and an alleged suicide note was found by police.

234.title: Gautam Gambhir names his Team India playing XI for match against Pakistan
234.article_body: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has named his Team India playing XI for their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. Gambhir chose Rishabh Pant over Dinesh Karthik. Other players in his XI include Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, Harshal Patel, Yuzvendra Chahal, Arshdeep Singh/Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Mohammad Shami.

235.title: Girls thrash man for peeping into their hostel washroom in MP
235.article_body: A man was thrashed by girls for allegedly peeping into their hostel washroom in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur. A purported video of the incident has gone viral on social media, where some girls are seen slapping a man and accusing him of misconduct. They also filed a police complaint against him, following which he was arrested.

236.title: Fire breaks out at banquet hall in Delhi's Rohini area
236.article_body: A fire broke out at a banquet hall in Sector 3 of northwest Delhi's Rohini on Friday afternoon, officials said. According to fire officials, the blaze was reported at 2:29 pm, upon which 13-14 fire tenders were rushed to the God Grace banquet hall. There were no immediate reports of casualties, as per officials.

237.title: Super 12 groups of T20 World Cup 2022 confirmed as Round 1 ends
237.article_body: The Super 12 groups of T20 World Cup 2022 have been finalised after Sri Lanka, Netherlands, Zimbabwe and Ireland advanced to the Super 12 stage following the Round 1. Sri Lanka and Ireland have made it to Group 1, while Netherlands and Zimbabwe are in Group 2, which also has teams like India, Pakistan and South Africa.

238.title: Video from site of Army helicopter crash in Arunachal Pradesh surfaces
238.article_body: A video has surfaced from the site where an Indian Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday and it shows black smoke rising up from forests in the mountainous area. The Advanced Light Helicopter crashed 25 km from Tuting headquarters in the Upper Siang district of the northeastern state. At least two people died in the crash.

239.title: Man fakes own kidnapping to 'gain sympathy' from his 2 wives in Maha, arrested
239.article_body: A man was arrested in Maharashtra's Thane for faking his own kidnapping to gain sympathy from his two wives, police said. Sandip Gaikwad (36) was 'kidnapped' by three people who came in an autorickshaw and beat him up, as per his second wife's complaint. It was later discovered the trio were Sandip's friends who helped him fake the kidnapping.

240.title: Congress will form govt in MP in 2023, waive farm loans: Kamal Nath
240.article_body: While addressing a rally on Thursday, former CM of Madhya Pradesh Kamal Nath stated that Congress will form its government in the state after the Assembly elections in 2023. The Congress leader claimed the party will waive farmers' loans and restore the old pension scheme for state employees soon after forming the government. Nath-led Congress government had collapsed in 2020.

241.title: CBI court rejects Anil Deshmukh's bail plea in alleged corruption case
241.article_body: A special CBI court rejected a bail petition of former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in an alleged corruption case of ₹100 crore. He was arrested on November 2 of last year and has been held at Arthur Road Jail ever since. Earlier, an ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner had alleged that Deshmukh had given target to officers to collect ₹100 crore.

242.title: 3 persons, including a pedestrian, injured as tree falls in Thane
242.article_body: Three persons, including a pedestrian, were injured after a tree fell on them in Thane city, a civic official said on Friday. The incident occurred near CIDCO bus stop on Thursday evening. The injured persons are being treated at a hospital and they are out of danger, Avinash Sawant, chief of Thane's Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC), said.

243.title: Zimbabwe reach 2nd stage of T20 World Cup for 1st time in history
243.article_body: Zimbabwe defeated Scotland by five wickets in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Group B first round match in Hobart. With this, they advanced to the second stage of a T20 World Cup for the first time in history. Batting first after winning the toss, Scotland put up a total of 132/6. Zimbabwe chased down the total in 18.3 overs.

244.title: 'Kantara' should be India's entry to Oscars next year: Kangana Ranaut
244.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories and wrote that Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' should be India's entry to the Oscars next year. She added that the film is an "experiential reality which world must experience". Kangana, who watched 'Kantara' on Thursday, in a video message praised Rishab's performance in the film, saying that his writing, direction and acting were "unbelievable".

245.title: Over 66,000 Russian soldiers killed in war so far, says Ukraine
245.article_body: Ukraine on Friday claimed that it has killed about 66,750 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said the country's forces have destroyed 2,573 Russian tanks and over 510 aircraft, including 243 helicopters. About 5,258 armoured personnel carriers, 1,648 artillery systems and 372 multiple launch rocket systems have also been destroyed, it added.

246.title: List of reserved wards for MCD election released
246.article_body: Delhi State Election Commission on Thursday released the list of wards that will be reserved for women and Scheduled Caste (SC) candidates for the upcoming Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) election. Out of the total 250 seats redrawn in the recently-concluded delimitation exercise, 42 have been reserved for SC candidates. Meanwhile, 50% of the overall seats are reserved for women.

247.title: Ajay's character's name in Thank God changed from Chitragupta to CG: Reports
247.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn's character's name in the upcoming movie 'Thank God' has been changed from Chitragupta to CG, according to reports. "The makers felt it was wise to avoid addressing him as Chitragupta...All dialogues where the word Chitragupta was mentioned were replaced with CG," a source was quoted as saying. The film has been passed with a U/A certificate.

248.title: Devotees visiting Kedarnath went from 5 lakh to 45 lakh in just 1 season: PM
248.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi claimed that the number of devotees visiting Kedarnath has increased significantly from 5 lakh to 45 lakh in just one season. He appealed to all the tourists to spend at least 5% of their travel budget on buying local products. He laid the foundation stone of several developmental projects in Uttarakhand.

249.title: Man seeks to be India's Prez to solve 'world affairs', SC calls plea 'abusive'
249.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday called an environmentalist's plea "scurrilous" after he sought appointment as the President of India, saying he wanted to work for all the 'messy situations of the world'. It said the petitioner Kishore Sawant's plea was "frivolous and an abuse of the process of the Court". Sawant's remarks must be expunged from records, it ordered.

250.title: Railway workers smuggle hash oil, ganja into B'luru from Assam, arrested
250.article_body: An AC attendant and two bedroll staffers of the North East Frontier Railway were arrested at Bengaluru's Baiyyappanahalli station for allegedly selling hash oil and ganja in the city after smuggling them from Assam. The contract workers allegedly used to hide drugs in the lockers assigned to them on trains. Police seized hash oil and ganja worth over ₹80 lakh.

251.title: Cargo train drives through flames after fuel tanker crash sparks fire in Mexico
251.article_body: A huge blaze erupted in central Mexico after a fuel tanker truck crashed into an overpass by a rail line on Thursday, scorching homes and leading to a mass evacuation, authorities said. One video shot from a car parked nearby showed a cargo train hurtling through the flames after the accident in Aguascalientes city. No casualties have been reported yet.

252.title: Prashant Kishor speaks for his own publicity: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
252.article_body: After poll strategist Prashant Kishor accused Bihar CM Nitish Kumar of keeping a channel open with the BJP, the JD(U) leader said that Kishor speaks for his own publicity. "He keeps talking...[He] can say whatever he wants. We don't care. There was a time when I respected him...I don't know what's on his mind now," said Kumar.

253.title: 10,500 cubic metres of floating waste removed from rivers, nullahs: BMC
253.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Thursday said that 10,500 cubic metres of floating waste have been removed from rivers and nullahs in Mumbai by using trash booms. The BMC had deployed trash booms in eight spots to reduce water pollution, remove floating waste and silt materials. The trash booms were deployed this year on a ₹45 crore contract.

254.title: Iran advises citizens not to visit Ukraine, asks those in Ukraine to leave
254.article_body: Iran has advised its citizens not to travel to Ukraine and urged Iranians in Ukraine to leave. This comes a day after the US said that Iranians had been on the grounds in Crimea, helping Russians target Ukraine with Iranian drones. In a closed-door UN meeting, US, UK and France accused Iran of selling drones to Russia, violating a ban.

255.title: Kejriwal silent on stubble burning in Punjab this time: Anil Vij
255.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij criticised AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal over stubble burning in Punjab, which causes air pollution in Delhi. "While Kejriwal used to speak about the stubble burning issue earlier, this time he has not yet spoken," said Vij. AAP is not doing anything about the issue even though the party is in power in Punjab, he added.

256.title: Rahul Gandhi to attend Kharge's oath ceremony on October 26: Reports
256.article_body: According to reports, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi is set to attend the oath-taking ceremony of Mallikarjun Kharge as the Congress National President in New Delhi on October 26. A change has also been made in the Bharat Jodo Yatra schedule. A three-day break has been kept for Rahul's rest, starting October 24.

257.title: Pak's Nawaz sits on knees in shock after his shot hits Masood on head, video surfaces
257.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing Pakistan's Muhammad Nawaz sitting on his knees in shock after his shot hit his teammate Shan Masood on the head during net practice. In the video, Nawaz also stands up and shakes his head, while Masood was being checked on by the support staff. Masood was taken to hospital for scans.

258.title: Don't want Ranveer in 'Khal Nayak' remake, he doesn't wear clothes: Sanjay Dutt
258.article_body: Taking a dig at Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot, Sanjay Dutt said he doesn't want him to play his role in 'Khal Nayak' remake as the actor doesn't wear clothes these days. He was responding to a question by Varun Sharma on comedy courtroom show 'Case Toh Banta Hai'. Ranveer hit headlines in July when he posed naked for Paper Magazine.

259.title: IDBI Bank's Q2 profit grows by 46% to ₹828 crore, NII rises by 48%
259.article_body: IDBI Bank, on Friday, posted a 46% year-on-year growth in standalone profit for the quarter ended September 30 to ₹828 crore from ₹567 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The growth was led by its net interest income (NII), which grew by 47.7% to ₹2,738 crore and its operating performance. Its net advances were ₹1.46 lakh crore.

260.title: Maharashtra govt restores general consent to CBI to probe cases in state
260.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government has reversed the previous Uddhav Thackeray-led Maha Vikas Aghadi government's decision of withdrawing the general consent to the CBI to investigate cases in the state. The Maharashtra government has restored the general consent given to the central probe agency, an official said. CBI will now no longer require the state government's permission to step in.

261.title: Kevin Spacey wins $40 million sexual assault lawsuit
261.article_body: A New York court has cleared Kevin Spacey in a $40 million sexual misconduct lawsuit. An actor had filed a lawsuit, claiming Spacey sexually abused him in 1985 when he was 14. After a three week-long trial, the jury found that prosecution couldn't prove Spacey had "touched a sexual or intimate body part", leading the judge to dismiss the case.

262.title: Russia planning to destroy hydroelectric dam in Kherson: Ukraine
262.article_body: Ukraine has claimed Russia is planning to sabotage the Kakhovka hydropower plant in the Russian-controlled Kherson region. "Russia is preparing a man-made catastrophe," a Ukrainian presidential aide stated on Thursday. He said Russia was mining the dam and transformers at the plant to flood the lower Dnieper River, where Ukrainian troops are mounting a counteroffensive against Russian forces.

263.title: US judge blocks New York from banning guns in church
263.article_body: A US federal judge has temporarily blocked the part of a New York state law that bans firearms from churches or other places of worship. Last week, two church leaders sued the state, saying such a constraint ran counter to the gun rights spelled out in the Second Amendment of US Constitution. New York Attorney General is reviewing the decision.

264.title: Russia says Ukraine killed 4 civilians evacuating Kherson, Ukraine denies
264.article_body: Russia has accused Ukrainian forces of deliberately attacking civilians evacuating from Russia-controlled region of Kherson, killing four and injuring 13. A Ukrainian official said the strike was carried out after the civilian curfew was put in place and people evacuating were part of Russia's security structures. Russian-installed authorities are evacuating 50,000-60,000 people from Kherson.

265.title: Sajid Khan showed me his genitals and made me touch them: Sherlyn Chopra
265.article_body: Sherlyn Chopra, who recently filed a complaint against #MeToo accused Sajid Khan, said, "Police asked me why it took me so long...I said...back then I didn't have the courage." "Sajid asked some [women] about sex...he showed me his genitals and made me touch them," she added. "Can a woman not share her pain even years after the incident?" Sherlyn stated.

266.title: 22-yr-old arrested for shooting at neighbour over parking issue in Delhi
266.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a 22-year-old for allegedly shooting at a 42-year-old neighbour over a parking issue in Vikas Nagar. "The victim was admitted to a hospital with a gunshot injury...after the treatment, he was said to be out of danger," DCP Sameer Sharma (Outer district) said. The accused was arrested from Ganda Nala within 24 hours after the incident.

267.title: Mumbai woman fights off child lifters, saves her 3-yr-old son
267.article_body: A woman fought and saved her three-year-old son from allegedly being snatched by three child lifters in Mumbai. The incident happened when the mother-son duo was walking on an empty road at Lokhandwala Township in Kandivali East, police said. The mother, Dipti Joshi (39), claimed that the accused were eunuchs, however, police suspect that might not be the case.

268.title: J&K administration asks Mehbooba Mufti to vacate official bungalow
268.article_body: J&K administration has served a notice to PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti to vacate her official bungalow in Srinagar's Gupkar. "The notice to evict from Fair View...has not come as a surprise and is along the expected lines," the former J&K CM said. "This place was allotted to my father in December 2005, after he relinquished the CM's office," Mufti added.

269.title: We don't expect UK to use political wisdom in choosing next PM: Kremlin
269.article_body: The Kremlin has said it did not expect UK to use "political wisdom" in choosing next leader. "People do not choose the person at the head of the executive branch, who appears as a result of internal party shake-ups," Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. Russian Foreign Ministry said former UK PM Liz Truss would be remembered for her "catastrophic illiteracy".

270.title: BSE, NSE to conduct 'muhurat trading' from 6:15 pm to 7:15 pm on Diwali
270.article_body: The BSE and the National Stock Exchange will conduct the Diwali 'muhurat trading' on Monday from 6:15 pm to 7:15 pm, the exchanges stated. The block deal session will take place from 5:45 pm to 6 pm and the pre-opening session will be held from 6 pm-6:08 pm. This will mark the beginning of the new Hindu calendar year—Samvat 2079.

271.title: We've disappointed our fans, haven't batted well: Pooran on WI's T20 WC exit
271.article_body: After two-time champions West Indies were eliminated from T20 World Cup 2022 following their nine-wicket loss against Ireland in Group B, West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said his side haven't batted well in the tournament. "We have disappointed our fans and ourselves. It's definitely hurting. I've disappointed my guys," he added. Chasing 147, Ireland scored 150/1 in 17.3 overs.

272.title: Section 144 to be imposed in Mumbai from November 1 to November 15: Police
272.article_body: Mumbai Police has issued an order stating that Section 144 will be imposed in the city from November 1 to November 15. The decision came after considering inputs from various agencies that warned about a disturbance in the law-and-order situation in the city. Accordingly, gathering of over five people in public places, processions and bursting of firecrackers have been banned.

273.title: Russian jet fired missile near British spy plane over Black Sea in Sept: UK
273.article_body: UK Defence Minister Ben Wallace has said a Russian fighter jet released a missile near an unarmed British spy plane patrolling the international airspace over the Black Sea in September. "It is a reminder of...how dangerous things can be when you...use your fighters in the manner that Russians have done," Wallace said. "We...concur it was a malfunction", Wallace added.

274.title: Debt-laden Future Retail's bid deadline extended to November 3
274.article_body: The resolution professional (RP) for debt-laden Future Retail Limited has extended the deadline, which ended on Thursday, for potential buyers to submit their bids. The new deadline is November 3. Future Retail, once the country's second-largest retailer, has been in bankruptcy proceedings after it defaulted on loans. Its lenders rejected a $3.4 billion sale of its assets to Reliance Industries.

275.title: 2 dead bodies found after army helicopter crash in Arunachal Pradesh
275.article_body: At least two dead bodies have been recovered from the site where an Indian Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang district on Friday, officials said. At least three people were on board the Advanced Light Helicopter (ALH) which crashed, triggering a search and rescue operation. Efforts are underway to find the rest of those on board.

276.title: T'gana's Yadagirigutta temple gets 'Green Place of Worship' award
276.article_body: Sri Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple in Telangana's Yadagirigutta has been awarded 'Green Place of Worship' by Indian Green Building Council (IGBC) for 2022 to 2025. The award was given for complying with norms like extensive greenery of over 40% of the area, according to Yadagirigutta Temple Development Authority. State CM K Chandrashekar Rao expressed happiness over the temple being awarded.

277.title: PM Modi to visit Ayodhya on Diwali eve to offer prayers at Ram temple
277.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh on the eve of Diwali (Sunday) to offer prayers at the Ram temple, the Prime Minister's Office said. The PM will also perform a symbolic coronation of Lord Ram and will later witness aarti at New Ghat, Saryu river, it added. Thereafter, he will launch the Deepotsav celebrations in Ayodhya.

278.title: It's not about Ranveer but award shows: Vivek on his 'colourful star' tweet
278.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has opened up about his tweet where he criticised Bollywood award shows, saying that a "colourful star managed to get all 10+ awards despite both of his films being disasters". Some people on Twitter speculated that he was referring to Ranveer Singh. Vivek said, "It's not about him. It's about the way these award events function."

279.title: Kejriwal issues order to ensure Yamuna is not polluted during Chhath
279.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that officials have been ordered to ensure that the Yamuna river is not polluted during Chhath Puja. "Chhath Puja will be celebrated like before on the ghats of the Yamuna," he tweeted. Earlier this month, Kejriwal said that the Delhi government has made arrangements at 1,100 sites for Chhath Puja celebrations.

280.title: Accidentally hurt Vinod during 'Muqaddar...' shoot, he got 16 stitches: Big B
280.article_body: On an episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Amitabh Bachchan revealed that he accidentally hurt his co-star, late actor Vinod Khanna, during the filming of 'Muqaddar Ka Sikandar'. He added that Vinod had to be rushed to a hospital, where he got 16 stitches. "I took him home to his wife, and apologised to her too for...accident," said Amitabh.

281.title: India's Lakshya beats compatriot Prannoy to enter Denmark Open quarters
281.article_body: Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen defeated compatriot HS Prannoy to enter the men's singles quarter-final at Denmark Open on Thursday. The CWG 2022 gold medal-winning shuttler won with a scoreline of 21-9, 21-18. Earlier in the day, Kidambi Srikanth lost 13-21, 15-21 to seventh seed Loh Kean Yew of Singapore. Meanwhile, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty entered the men's doubles quarter-final.

282.title: Hyd to increase sewage treatment plant capacity to curb Hussain Sagar pollution
282.article_body: To curb pollution in Hussain Sagar Lake, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) has decided to double the capacity of Sewage Treatment Plants (STP). The STPs which are currently functioning under Hussain Sagar Lake Project were constructed in collaboration with a Japanese firm between 2012-14. The capacity of existing STPs ranges from five to 60 MLD (Million Litres per Day).

283.title: HDFC Life Insurance's net profit grows by 19.25% in Sept quarter
283.article_body: HDFC Life Insurance Company on Friday posted a 19.25% growth in its consolidated net profit for the quarter ended September at ₹329.02 crore. Its net premium income rose by 14.56% to ₹13,137.89 crore. The company's solvency ratio improved to 210% year-on-year from 190%. For the first half of the fiscal, its annual premium equivalent grew 11%.

284.title: Putin hugs Russian soldiers, fires sniper rifle as he visits training camp
284.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday inspected a training ground for the newly drafted personnel who will participate in Moscow's 'special military operation' in Ukraine. Russian state television showed Putin lying flat on the ground and firing from a rifle during the visit to the training camp in the Ryazan region. The 70-year-old was also seen hugging military men.

285.title: Elon Musk's deals may face security reviews in US: Report
285.article_body: The US government is reportedly considering reviewing some of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's deals and operations over potential national security risks. Musk's bid to acquire Twitter can be among the deals that face scrutiny as authorities are concerned about foreign investors involved in the deal, Bloomberg reported. Musk's satellite internet service network Starlink can also reportedly face review.

286.title: Some people are justifying targeted killings in valley: J&K Lt Guv
286.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha warned people who are justifying the targeted killings of citizens in the valley and said that action will be taken against those who are trying to jeopardise the nation's integrity. "We are keeping an eye on elements that are trying to jeopardise communal harmony. Some people are justifying the killings...because of their self-interest," said Sinha.

287.title: 2 dead bodies mistakenly swapped at Pimpri Chinchwad civic hospital
287.article_body: Two dead bodies were mistakenly swapped at Yashwantrao Chavan Memorial Hospital run by Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation on Wednesday. The family of one of the deceased also performed the last rites of the wrong corpse they had received. The other family noticed the blunder while claiming the body. Upset with this, they attacked the dean and vandalised the hospital.

288.title: Amazon shuts down online store Fabric.com 14 yrs after acquisition
288.article_body: Amazon has closed online fabric store Fabric.com which was launched in 1999. Amazon acquired the store in 2008, saying this would give its crafting customers more variety to choose from. "As part of our regular business planning, we continually evaluate the progress and potential of our offerings and have made the decision to close Fabric.com," Amazon spokesperson Betsy Harden said.

289.title: Noida to come up with dog policy, 18 shelters to be constructed
289.article_body: After complaints and conflicts among residents related to dog attacks, Noida authority announced to draw up a dog policy, which includes the construction of 18 stray dog shelters. It will also earmark two or three feeding points. A list of dog feeders is also being prepared and the authority has asked people to volunteer to feed the strays.

290.title: 3 workers die while working in septic tank of Pune housing society
290.article_body: Three workers reportedly died while manually cleaning a septic tank of a private housing society in Pune's Wagholi on Friday. "The victims were working in an 18-feet deep drainage-cum-septic tank. It seems...they were suffocated and got stuck inside," an official said. The bodies of all three workers have been recovered.

291.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan barred from holding public office in state gifts case
291.article_body: The Election Commission of Pakistan has disqualified former Pakistan PM Imran Khan from holding public office for allegedly misleading officials about gifts he got from foreign leaders while in power. Khan allegedly received gifts worth millions of dollars and failed to declare some of them and unlawfully sold them. Khan will consequently lose his Parliament seat.

292.title: Lacks integrity: TikTok on report claiming it planned to track US citizens
292.article_body: TikTok has denied allegations made in a Forbes report that its China-based parent firm ByteDance planned to use the app to track location of specific US citizens. Stating that the reporting lacks "journalistic integrity", TikTok said it "doesn't collect precise GPS location" of US users. The app has "never been used to target" US government members or activists, TikTok said.

293.title: Consignment of smuggled liquor worth ₹13.37 lakh seized in Palghar
293.article_body: A consignment of smuggled Indian-made foreign liquor worth ₹13.37 lakh was seized in Pawan village in Palghar, Maharashtra. The police seized the liquor when they went to search an abandoned tempo in Dahanu's Kasa area of the village. The liquor was being brought in from the Union Territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, police said.

294.title: It's my duty: Chinese diplomat defends pulling HK protestor's hair in UK
294.article_body: A Chinese diplomat filmed pulling the hair of a Hong Kong pro-democracy protester on the grounds of the consulate in Manchester last week, defended his actions, saying it was his "duty". The demonstrator had "abused my country, my leader [Xi Jinping]", Chinese Consul-General Zheng Xiyuan said. Any diplomat would do the same if faced with such behaviour, he added.

295.title: DeHaat raises $45.8 million at $695 million valuation: Report
295.article_body: Agritech startup DeHaat has secured $45.8 million in a Series E funding round led by Sofina Ventures at $695 million valuation, Moneycontrol reported citing company's filing. The round also saw participation from RTP Global, Prosus and Lightrock India. The company was founded in 2012 by IIT, IIM and NIT alumni Shashank Kumar, Adarsh Srivastava, Shyam Sundar Singh and Amrendra Singh.

296.title: When I watch Indian action film I feel I'm working in wrong nation: H'wood director on RRR
296.article_body: Praising SS Rajamouli's 'RRR', Hollywood director Daniel Kwan tweeted, "After a...year of work and travelling I've finally checked a couple things off my list 1) finished my taxes (I know the irony) and 2) watched 'RRR'." "HOLY COW ya'll weren't kidding. Anytime I watch an Indian action film I feel like I'm working in the wrong country," he added.

297.title: Hyd woman trafficked from UAE to Oman, tortured; son seeks govt help
297.article_body: A man has urged External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar to repatriate his 42-year-old Hyderabadi mother, who's stuck in Oman with health complications, to India. Shaheen Begum had reportedly flown to the UAE from Hyderabad to work as a housemaid. Her son said she was later trafficked from the UAE to Oman, where she's being tortured while working as a housemaid.

298.title: Actress Anna May Wong becomes 1st Asian-American to be featured on US currency
298.article_body: Late Hollywood actress Anna May Wong is set to become first Asian-American to feature on US currency. A quarter-dollar coin featuring Wong's face will begin circulating from October 24, US Mint said. "Wong left a lasting legacy for Asian American women with an accomplished career in motion pictures, television, and theatre," White House Initiative on AA and NHPIs said.

299.title: Adani Group mulls raising $10 billion debt next year: Report
299.article_body: Adani Group is reportedly planning to raise at least $10 billion in new debt through next year to refinance large borrowings and fund projects in its pipeline, Bloomberg News quoted sources as saying. The Gautam Adani-led conglomerate could use foreign currency debt and green bonds to raise up to $6 billion to swap its current high-interest debt with lower-cost borrowings.

300.title: SC agrees to hear plea against release of Bilkis Bano rape convicts
300.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear a plea filed by the National Federation of Indian Women against the early release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. Earlier, the Gujarat government told the court that the convicts were released with the Centre's approval. Bilkis was 21 years old and five-month pregnant when she was gangraped.

301.title: We won't penalise employees for working remotely: IBM Consulting
301.article_body: IBM Consulting is asking employees to return to office three days per week. The company, however, has stated it will not penalise employees who are unable to go into the workplace. "We understand the importance of balancing both your work and home life as we move to a hybrid work model," the company said in its Return to Workplace FAQs.

302.title: Soothe Healthcare raises ₹175 crore in a fresh funding round
302.article_body: Soothe Healthcare, a personal hygiene brand, has secured ₹175 crore in a fresh funding round, in which the US International Development Finance Corporation invested ₹55 crore. Existing investors including A91 Partners, Symphony, Sixth Sense and Gulf Islamic Investments invested ₹120 crore. In 2021, it raised ₹230 crore in Series C round led by Northern Arc, and InCred, among others.

303.title: Enhance anti-money laundering system: US regulator to ICICI New York branch
303.article_body: ICICI Bank's New York branch has been issued a consent order by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency in the US for its failure to comply with anti-money laundering rules and the Bank Secrecy Act. The order requires the branch to ensure compliance and its general manager will have to submit a written action plan within 60 days.

304.title: BMW Group to invest $1.7 billion to produce EVs in US
304.article_body: The BMW Group will invest $1.7 billion to produce EVs in the US. The investment of $1 billion will be used to prepare for producing EVs at the company's existing manufacturing facility in South Carolina and $700 million will be used to build a battery assembly facility. The German automaker partnered with Envision AESC, which will produce lithium-ion battery cells.

305.title: Gurugram man cheated of ₹1 cr on pretext of mutual fund investments
305.article_body: A couple has been booked for allegedly cheating an 83-year-old man of over ₹1 crore on pretext of investing in mutual funds in Gurugram, police said. The man is a retired Lok Sabha staffer. "The complainant had managed to recover over ₹30 lakh by writing to firms where his money had been invested with forged documents," a police officer said.

306.title: Russian court orders arrest of journalist who protested war on live TV
306.article_body: A Russian court has ordered the arrest of journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who protested against the Russian invasion of Ukraine during an on-air news bulletin, Interfax reported. Ovsyannikova's lawyer earlier said that she fled Russia after refusing to be under house arrest. The journalist was accused of spreading fake news about Russian armed forces during one-person protest near the Kremlin.

307.title: PM Modi lays foundation stone of connectivity projects worth ₹3,400 cr in Uttarakhand
307.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday laid the foundation stone of various connectivity projects worth over ₹3,400 crore at Mana village in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district. The projects unveiled by the PM include two new ropeway projects connecting Gaurikund to Kedarnath and Govindghat to Hemkund Sahib. "For me, every village on the border is the first village in India," PM added.

308.title: SC dismisses plea seeking opening of 22 rooms of Taj Mahal
308.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea seeking the "opening of 22 rooms" on the premises of the Taj Mahal and a "fact-finding inquiry" into the monument's history. The petition was earlier dismissed by Allahabad High Court. "The high court was not in error in dismissing the petition, which is more of a publicity interest litigation," the SC said.

309.title: 3-year-old shoots and kills 15-month-old baby in US; probe on
309.article_body: A 15-month-old baby has died after being shot in the face by a three-year-old in the US state of Pennsylvania on Tuesday. The victim's grandfather told local media that the three-year-old was a relative. The Lancaster Bureau of Police is investigating the incident and said that adults were being questioned. No arrests have been made so far.

310.title: Missing food delivery executive found dead in nullah in Pune
310.article_body: A food delivery executive who went missing on October 17 was found dead on Friday in a nullah in Pune, police said. The deceased's brother claimed that it was raining heavily when his brother went to deliver food and added, "We suspect he might've got washed away in...rainwater." A probe is on to ascertain cause of death, an inspector said.

311.title: Girl gets paper re-checked, beats twin sister to become Class 12 UP board exam topper
311.article_body: Divya from Fatehpur district has become the new topper of Class 12 Uttar Pradesh board exam, taking away the top spot from her twin sister Divyanshi who scored 477/500. Divya, who scored 56 marks in Hindi, had applied for re-evaluation of the paper, following which the marks rose to 94, District Inspector of Schools said. Divya has scored 479/500.

312.title: ED seizes jewellery worth ₹149 cr during raids in Hyderabad, Vijayawada
312.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has seized jewellery stocks worth more than ₹149 crore during recent raids at five locations in Hyderabad and Vijayawada. The raids were conducted in a case related to alleged cheating with MMTC, a public sector enterprise. The search operations were conducted at MBS Jewellers Pvt Ltd and Musaddilal Gems and Jewels India Pvt Ltd.

313.title: List of 10 all time best Indian films released
313.article_body: The India chapter of the International Federation of Film Critics (FIPRESCI) has released a list of the top 10 films in the history of Indian cinema. Satyajit Ray's Pather Panchali topped the list followed by 1960 drama Meghe Dhaka Tara, Bhuvan Shome (1969), Malayalam film Elippathayam (1981), Ghatashraddha (1977) and Garm Hava (1973). Sholay has been ranked 10th by FIPRESCI.

314.title: Fraudster arrested for cheating Mumbai investor of ₹12 lakh
314.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 38-year-old fraudster from Tamil Nadu for allegedly cheating a man of ₹12 lakh on the pretext of high returns on diamond trading investment. The police has seized at least five crypto wallets in which cryptocurrency worth lakhs of rupees was kept. It has also confiscated 119 mobile phones used by the accused.

315.title: At least 150 people killed in 2 days of fighting in Sudan
315.article_body: At least 150 people have reportedly been killed in ethnic clashes in the last two days in Sudan's Blue Nile state. The violence broke out last week between rival ethnic groups following a land dispute in which more than a dozen people were killed. Sudan has been grappling with political unrest and violence since last year's military coup.

316.title: Priyanka Gandhi to hold 8 rallies, roadshows in Himachal Pradesh
316.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh polls, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi will hold eight rallies and roadshows in the state until November 10. She will start her campaign from Mandi and Kullu on October 31 before visiting Kangra and Chamba on November 3. The state will go to polls on November 12 and the votes will be counted on December 8.

317.title: Youths who pelted stones in J&K now becoming sarpanches: Amit Shah
317.article_body: On the occasion of Police Commemoration Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that youths who pelted stones in Jammu and Kashmir are now becoming panches and sarpanches. "Earlier, armed forces were given special power, now youth is given special power for their progress," he added. Most hotspots in the country are "almost free" from anti-national activities, he further said.

318.title: Sachin Tendulkar forays into NFTs as a strategic investor in Rario
318.article_body: Rario, a licensed digital cricket collectibles platform, announced that Sachin Tendulkar has invested in and partnered with the company for his exclusive NFTs/digital collectibles. Rario stated that it has already exclusively partnered with Aaron Finch, Quinton de Kock, Shakib Al Hasan, Rishabh Pant, Virender Sehwag, Zaheer Khan, Smriti Mandhana, Cricket Australia, New Zealand Cricket among others.

319.title: Muslims can never trust people who worship Godse: SP MLA Mehmood
319.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Iqbal Mehmood on Thursday claimed that Muslims can never vote for BJP as they can "never trust people who worship Godse, the killer of Mahatma Gandhi". He also alleged that the AIMIM, which is led by Asaduddin Owaisi, is BJP's "B team". "A true Muslim can never vote for BJP," he further said.

320.title: Video shows bus on fire in Andhra; passengers lose cash, jewellery
320.article_body: A bus carrying about 60 passengers was gutted in fire in Andhra Pradesh on Friday, a video of which has surfaced. No passengers were hurt in the incident, however, many lost their belongings, including cash, gold jewellery and other valuables. The fire reportedly started in the engine. The driver noticed the smoke and evacuated the bus before it was engulfed.

321.title: Virat Kohli asks fans to not speak while he is practising, video goes viral
321.article_body: A video went viral showing Virat Kohli telling fans not to speak while he was practising in the nets. In the video, a fan can be heard shouting "Out of the stadium" after Kohli hit a ball. After that, Kohli said, "Please don't speak while I'm practising...It's very distracting." The fans can then be heard telling Kohli they won't speak.

322.title: Diwali to be a public school holiday in New York City schools from 2023
322.article_body: Diwali will be a public school holiday in New York City starting next year. Mayor Eric Adams announced plans to include the holiday in the public school schedule on Thursday. "We're going to have children start talking about what it is to celebrate the Festival of Lights, and how do you turn a light on within yourself," Adams said.

323.title: World War 3 very unlikely, it's the closest we have been since 1962: Elon Musk
323.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said the World War 3 is "still very unlikely" to happen. In response to a Twitter user's query on the likelihood of a world war, Musk wrote that this is the closest the world has been since 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis. "It...would be nice to have one year without a horrible global event," he added.

324.title: Policeman steals gold ornaments from friend's house in Kerala
324.article_body: A policeman has been arrested for allegedly stealing eight sovereigns of gold ornaments from his friend's house in Kerala's Ernakulam district. The police suspect that online rummy gaming led the accused, 35-year-old Amal Dev, to indulge in theft. "He was a regular visitor to his friend's house...The investigation on the visitors of the house led to him," said police.

325.title: 2-time champions West Indies crash out of T20 World Cup 2022
325.article_body: Two-time champions West Indies crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022 after losing their Group B first round match against Ireland on Friday. Ireland restricted West Indies to 146/5 in 20 overs before chasing down the target in 17.3 overs. Ireland have qualified for the Super 12 stage by winning two out of three matches in the first round.

326.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted Noida woman, garlanded after release
326.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested for assaulting a woman in Noida, was garlanded after his release from jail. A video surfaced online in which his supporters can be seen showering flowers on him and shouting "Shrikant bhaiya zindabad". "One of our sisters was put forward...attempt was made to finish me politically by staging a dispute between us," Tyagi said.

327.title: Govt eyeing $7.7 billion valuation for IDBI Bank stake sale: Report
327.article_body: The government is pushing for a valuation of nearly $7.7 billion for IDBI Bank, which could be the biggest sale of the government's stake in a lender in decades, Bloomberg quoted a source as saying. The regulatory approvals and security clearances could be reportedly given to bidders after November. IDBI Bank's market value was about $5.8 billion as of Thursday.

328.title: Musk & Twitter's advisers prepare to close deal by Oct end: Report
328.article_body: Elon Musk and Twitter's advisers are preparing paperwork to complete the $44 billion takeover deal by October 28, Bloomberg reported. Talks between SpaceX CEO and the social media platform have reportedly turned cordial after months of accusations, with focus on closing the transaction. The Wall Street banks are working on steps to finalise funding about $13 billion of debt commitments.

329.title: Putin critic Navalny says he faces new criminal case, up to 30 yrs in jail
329.article_body: Jailed Russian opposition politician Alexey Navalny on Thursday said that Russian authorities have opened a new criminal case against him for "promoting terrorism and extremism" that could potentially more than double his current prison sentence. The 46-year-old critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin is currently serving more than 11 years for fraud, contempt of court and parole violations.

330.title: Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh
330.article_body: An Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday, according to reports. The site of accident is not connected by road and a rescue team has been sent, Defence PRO, Guwahati, said. Earlier this month, a MiG-29K fighter aircraft crashed during a routine sortie over sea off Goa coast after it developed a technical malfunction while returning to base.

331.title: Why has Google been fined ₹1,337.76 crore by the CCI?
331.article_body: The CCI has imposed ₹1,337.76 crore fine on Google for abusing its dominant position in multiple markets in Android mobile device ecosystem. Google imposes "unfair condition" on device makers by requiring them to preinstall its apps, the CCI said. It added that Google abused its dominant position in search, app stores, web browsers and video services to squeeze out competitors.

332.title: Google sued by Texas for allegedly collecting biometric data without consent
332.article_body: US state of Texas has filed a lawsuit against Google for allegedly collecting biometric data of millions of Texans, since 2015, without prior consent. Google used people's faces and voices through Google Photos, Google Assistant, and Nest Hub Max, the complaint said. Google said it will fight the case, adding that users had option to turn off biometric collection feature.

333.title: Girl allegedly gets poked in an eye with pencil at Punjab school, loses sight
333.article_body: A six-year-old girl's parents staged a protest outside a school in Punjab's Ludhiana after a classmate allegedly poked her in the eye with a pencil causing her to lose sight in one eye. The parents claimed that the school misled them about the cause of the injury and sent their daughter home instead of rushing her to a hospital.

334.title: Shah pays tribute at police memorial, says their sacrifice will be remembered
334.article_body: On the occasion of Police Commemoration Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah paid tribute to police personnel, who lost their lives in the line of duty, at the National Police Memorial. He said that their sacrifice would always be remembered. The day is observed every year in memory of the 10 policemen killed by Chinese troops in 1959.

335.title: Delhivery's stock hits record low after falling below IPO price
335.article_body: Shares of logistics company Delhivery fell by nearly 18% on Friday to ₹382.25 as it expected moderate growth of shipment volumes for the rest of FY23. The Gurugram-based company's stock is now below its IPO price of ₹487/share, which is a record low since it was listed on the bourses earlier this year. On Thursday, its shares plunged by 17.07%.

336.title: IAS officer Narain gets transit anticipatory bail in alleged rape case
336.article_body: Delhi HC granted transit anticipatory bail till October 28 to senior IAS officer Jitendra Narain for his alleged involvement in a rape case. "It wouldn't be appropriate to consider the allegations and counter allegations at this stage as it may prejudice the case of either party," HC said. Narain is accused of raping a woman in Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

337.title: Gurugram Police book banker & wife for cheating retired officer of ₹1 crore
337.article_body: The Gurugram Police booked a couple for allegedly cheating a retired central government officer of ₹1 crore on the pretext of investing his money in the share market. According to police, the prime suspect worked at a private bank while his wife was a sub-broker with an investment firm. The accused confessed to losing ₹1 crore in betting.

338.title: Important that UK finds stability as soon as possible: French Prez
338.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said it was important that Britain found "stability as soon as possible" amid the resignation of British Prime Minister Liz Truss. "On a personal level, I am always sad to see a colleague go," he added. Liz Truss resigned as UK Prime Minister on Thursday after 45 days in office amid a massive economic crisis.

339.title: Governor seeks report on sexual assault of 4-yr-old girl in Hyd
339.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan has sought a report from the state government on the alleged sexual assault of a four-year-old girl, an LKG student, at Hyderabad's DAV Public School by the principal's driver. Soundararajan called for immediate action against the perpetrator. The driver was arrested on Tuesday, while the principal was arrested for negligence a day later.

340.title: Harsha Bhogle names his all-time T20 World Cup XI; includes 1 Indian, 2 Pakistani players
340.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle has named his all-time T20 World Cup XI. Virat Kohli features as the only Indian, and Shahid Afridi and Umar Gul features as two Pakistani cricketers in his XI. He named Chris Gayle and Jos Buttler as the openers. Other players include Kevin Pietersen, Michael Hussey, Shane Watson, Lasith Malinga, Trent Bould and Samuel Badree.

341.title: India can't dictate how Pakistan will play cricket: Wasim Akram
341.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah saying India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023 and will look for a neutral venue, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "India can’t dictate how Pakistan will play cricket." He added, "If Shah had to say something...he should've called PCB chief Ramiz Raja. There should have been a meeting of Asian Cricket Council."

342.title: Woman slaps guard, pulls female guard's hair as fight breaks out at Noida society
342.article_body: A woman was seen slapping a guard and pulling a female guard's hair after a fight broke out between two groups of residents at a society in Noida. The fight started at the Hyde Park society in Sector 78 over a residents' body election. Security guards were accused of manipulating the election and helping one of the groups.

343.title: Pic of close up of ant's face wins photography competition; people call it 'horrifying'
343.article_body: A picture of an ant's face, magnified five times under a microscope, has won the 2022 Nikon Small World Photomicrography Competition. Reacting to the picture by Lithuanian photographer Eugenijus Kavaliauskas, social media users wrote, "Horrifying," and, "Is this an alien?" Reacting to the comments, the photographer said, "There are no horrors in nature."

344.title: Earlier govts made fun of tribal traditions, we respect them: PM
344.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday laid the foundation stone of multiple development initiatives worth over ₹1,970 crore in Gujarat's Tapi and said that there are political parties who've a history of making false promises, however, BJP has always given priority to tribal welfare. "While earlier governments made fun of tribal traditions, we on the other hand respect...tribal traditions," he added.

345.title: 3 die of asphyxiation while cleaning drain at Pune residential society
345.article_body: At least three workers died of asphyxiation while cleaning a drain at a residential society in Pune's Wagholi area on Friday morning, a fire brigade official said. The victims entered the drain around 6 am and local residents informed the police and the fire brigade when they noticed that they were not responding around 7 am.

346.title: Chahal's wife Dhanashree trolls Urvashi with 'My heart led me to Australia' post
346.article_body: While going to join husband Yuzvendra Chahal for the T20 World Cup, choreographer Dhanashree trolled actress Urvashi Rautela in an Instagram post. Sharing a picture from a plane, Dhanashree wrote, "My [heart] led me to Australia, literally. Got to be there for my man." Earlier, Urvashi shared a flight selfie and wrote, "Followed my [heart]...it led me to Australia."

347.title: BJP responsible for garbage mountains in Delhi: AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj
347.article_body: After Union Home Minister Amit Shah accused AAP of step-motherly treatment towards the three municipal corporations in Delhi, AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj claimed that the BJP is responsible for garbage mountains in the national capital. "The BJP-led MCD was tasked with managing waste but still Delhi is categorised as one of the most unsanitary cities in our country," said Bharadwaj.

348.title: $40 bn wiped off digital ad firms' m-cap after Snap's revenue warning
