348.article_body: After Snapchat-parent Snap on Thursday warned that it would see no revenue growth in the holiday quarter, shares of digital ad companies, including Meta and Google-owner Alphabet dropped by 4% and 2%, respectively. Snap's stock fell by 25%, while Pinterest's declined nearly 8%. The sell-off erased over $40 billion in market value from these firms and other internet ad companies.

349.title: Harry Potter-themed coins released in UK to celebrate 25 years of the series
349.article_body: The Royal Mint, which makes all the coins in the United Kingdom, has released Harry Potter-themed 50p coins to celebrate 25th anniversary of the publication of 'Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone' by JK Rowling in 1997. Royal Mint designer Ffion Gwillim, who modelled the artwork onto coins, said, "The Harry Potter illustrations are so iconic and recognisable."

350.title: IIT graduates' GlobalFair raises $20 mn in Series A funding round
350.article_body: GlobalFair, a B2B building material supplier started by two IIT graduates, Shaily Garg and Ashish Chandra, has secured $20 million in Series A funding round through equity and debt. Lightspeed Venture Partners led the funding round, which also saw participation from Saama Capital, Stride Ventures, India Quotient, and AUM Ventures.

351.title: Doctor, wife die by electrocution from geyser at Hyderabad apartment
351.article_body: A 26-year-old doctor and his 22-year-old wife reportedly died by electrocution from the geyser at their apartment in Hyderabad. The woman's father found the bodies of the couple in the bathroom. The police suspect that the woman suffered electric shock from the geyser first and her husband got electrocuted while trying to save her.

352.title: U'khand HC asks SIT to file status report in Ankita Bhandari murder case
352.article_body: Uttarakhand High Court on Thursday directed the Special Investigation Team (SIT) investigating the Ankita Bhandari murder case to file a status report along with the case diary. HC fixed November 3 as the date for the next hearing. This comes after a plea was filed by a resident of Pauri Garhwal seeking that the probe is handed over to CBI.

353.title: Jaffer lists T20 World Cup teams' weaknesses, trolls England for not having a PM
353.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to list T20 World Cup 2022 teams' weaknesses. He wrote, "India don't have a 150 kmph+ bowler. Pakistan don't have a seasoned finisher. New Zealand don't have great record in Australia. Sri Lanka don't have an experienced squad." Trolling England over the current political situation, he joked, "England don't have a Prime Minister."

354.title: I'm shaking, won't recover for another week: Kangana after watching 'Kantara'
354.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she was "shaking" after watching 'Kantara'. "What an explosive experience. Rishab Shetty, hats off to you...I heard so many people in the theatre say that they had never seen anything like this. Thank you for this film. I don't think I will recover from this experience for another week," she added.

355.title: CRPF constable rapes woman on pretext of marriage in Delhi; held
355.article_body: A CRPF constable was arrested for allegedly raping a woman multiple times in Delhi, police said on Thursday. The woman had filed a complaint against the accused claiming that he raped her on the pretext of marriage, according to police. Both the accused and complainant are in process of getting separated from their respective spouses, an officer said.

356.title: Major Mumbai roads, traffic islands to be illuminated between Oct 22-29
356.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to illuminate major public places, roads, traffic islands and other places in Mumbai between October 22 and 29, reports said. "Funds for these works have been classified as incidental expenditure to each ward office. Therefore, immediate action should be taken by calling for spot tenders," a BMC release said.

357.title: US diplomat's wife pleads guilty over UK car crash that killed teen
357.article_body: Anne Sacoolas, the wife of an American diplomat, pleaded guilty on Thursday to causing the death of a teenager by driving carelessly in England in August 2019. The 19-year-old, Harry Dunn, was killed when his motorcycle was hit by Sacoolas' car near a US military base in Northamptonshire. Following the incident, Sacoolas fled the UK under diplomatic immunity.

358.title: Liz Truss entitled to ₹1 crore/year for life despite only serving 45 days as UK PM
358.article_body: Liz Truss is entitled to £115,000 (over ₹1 crore) per year for the rest of her life as a former Prime Minister, despite only being in office for 45 days. Truss, who became the shortest-serving leader in British history, resigned amid massive economic crisis. She had defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race.

359.title: Student ends life over fear of not getting job placement in Pune
359.article_body: A 22-year-old student allegedly died by suicide on Thursday over the fear of not being able to get a job placement in Pune. The deceased, who was studying design at a college in the city, was under immense pressure for the past few days, police said. The police have not revealed whether a suicide note was recovered from the deceased.

360.title: Over 7,000 unrecognised madrasas found in UP survey so far
360.article_body: Over 7,000 unrecognised madrasas have been found in Uttar Pradesh so far in the ongoing survey by the government, said UP Madarsa Education Board Chairman Iftikhar Ahmed Javed. "The number of these [unrecognised] madrasas is expected to go up as information is still pouring in," he added. "After the survey, we are going to clean the system," he further said.

361.title: Instagram update lets users block all existing accounts of a person
361.article_body: Instagram has made an update that allows users to block all existing accounts of a person. Last year, the social media platform gave users the ability to block a person from contacting them through any new accounts that they may create. Additionally, the platform said its 'Hidden Words' feature will now also support more languages including Russian, Bengali and Tamil.

362.title: SC grants interim bail to accused in 2017 Gurugram school murder case
362.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday granted interim bail to the accused in the 2017 Gurugram school murder case in which the then 16-year-old had murdered his seven-year-old junior, Pradyuman Thakur. The Juvenile Justice Board on Monday ruled that the accused student should be tried as an adult and not as a juvenile. The accused has been in detention for five years.

363.title: PM offers prayers at Kedarnath Temple, wears 'Chola Dora' made by women of Chamba
363.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday offered prayers at Kedarnath Temple ahead of laying the foundation stone of Kedarnath Ropeway Project. PM Modi wore a traditional outfit popularly known as 'Chola Dora', which was made by women of Chamba. It was gifted to PM Modi during his recent visit to Himachal Pradesh.

364.title: HCL Founder Shiv Nadar donated ₹3 crore per day over the last year: Hurun
364.article_body: Shiv Nadar, the billionaire Founder and Chairman Emeritus of HCL Technologies, donated ₹3 crore per day over the last year, according to EdelGive Hurun India Philanthropy List 2022. The 77-year-old industrialist reclaimed the title of being 'India's Most Generous', topping the philanthropy list with a yearly donation of ₹1,161 crore. The primary cause of his philanthropy is arts and culture.

365.title: Chidambaram suggests PM meet with 5 professionals over falling rupee
365.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram has claimed that the government seems "helpless against the relentless" rupee depreciation. He suggested that PM Narendra Modi should hold a closed-door meeting with five "eminent professionals", including former RBI Governors, C Rangarajan, Y V Reddy and Raghuram Rajan, over the matter. BJP leader Amit Malviya criticised the suggestion, calling it "unsolicited" advice.

366.title: India reports 2,119 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 25,037
366.article_body: India reported 2,119 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,141 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 25,037. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,953 following 10 casualties in the last 24 hours.

367.title: Russia turning Ukraine power grid into new battleground: Zelenskyy
367.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday told European Union that "Russia's leadership has given the order to turn the energy system itself into a battlefield". The Russian strikes are "aimed at creating as many electricity and heat problems as possible for Ukraine this fall and winter and for as many Ukrainians as possible to go to your countries", he added.

368.title: Permira appoints ex-Warburg exec Siddharth Narayan as India head
368.article_body: UK-based global private equity firm Permira has appointed Siddharth Narayan as its India head, based in Mumbai. Prior to joining Permira, Narayan worked at American PE firm Warburg Pincus. He had also been associated with Lightspeed Venture Partners and McKinsey & Company. He holds an MBA from The Wharton School and is an alumnus of Indian Institute of Technology, Madras.

369.title: Make this Diwali a happy and healthy Diwali: Oleev
369.article_body: Oleev shared that since cooking oil used in food matters as much as the ingredients, one must make a conscious choice in choosing it, especially during the festive season. Oleev Active is a multisource oil with the goodness of olive oil for Indian cooking, it stated, encouraging customers to choose health, good habits and a proactive lifestyle this Diwali.

370.title: Don't follow rumours, wait for facts: Twitter on report of Musk firing 75% staff
370.article_body: Twitter's top lawyer told employees not to follow "rumours or leaked documents but rather wait for facts", after a report claimed that Elon Musk plans to lay off 75% of the company's entire workforce. Twitter doesn't have any confirmation of Musk's plans following the close of the deal, the company's top lawyer said, warning employees of "public rumours and speculation".

371.title: Illegal online horse betting racket busted in Hyderabad; 2 arrested
371.article_body: An illegal horse betting racket being run through WhatsApp was busted in Hyderabad, said police. Two suspects, a 45-year-old bookie and a 23-year-old accountant, were arrested. According to police, the accused ran the operation through a WhatsApp group named Turf Line and used to collect money through online apps PhonePe and Google Pay.

372.title: Sensex, Nifty gain on last trading day of Samvat 2078
372.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on the last trading day of Samvat 2078 with the Sensex gaining 300 points and the Nifty above 17,600 points. Axis Bank, M&M, Titan Company, SBI Life Insurance and HDFC Life were among the major gainers on Nifty. The stocks of Bajaj Finance, TCS, Tech Mahindra, Power Grid Corporation and Divi's Labs slipped.

373.title: You can't have Bumrah breaking down 10 days before the World Cup: Roger Binny
373.article_body: BCCI President Roger Binny said that the cricket board needs to address why and how players are breaking down "so easily". "You can't have Jasprit Bumrah breaking down 10 days before the World Cup," he added. "It's not...we don't have good trainers or coaches. Whether...load is too much, whether they're playing too many formats...something needs to be done," Binny said.

374.title: Bengaluru becomes 2nd Indian city to get 90-m aerial ladder platform
374.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday dedicated a 90-metre aerial ladder platform vehicle to the Bengaluru Fire Department, which would allow officials to reach high-rise buildings in emergency situations. Bengaluru became the second Indian city, after Mumbai, to have it. "Till now, the Bengaluru Fire Department had only a 50-metre ladder," said Bommai.

375.title: 19-yr-old Grandmaster Hans Niemann sues Carlsen, others for $100 mn over cheating claims
375.article_body: US' 19-year-old Grandmaster Hans Niemann has sued world chess champion Magnus Carlsen, Chess.com and others for slander and libel over cheating allegations. Niemann stated the defendants are "colluding to blacklist" him from professional chess world. The lawsuit claims the defendants have made "defamatory statements" by accusing him of cheating and the claims have resulted in him being ostracised.

376.title: Maharashtra govt decides to waive farmers' loans of over ₹964 crore
376.article_body: The Maharashtra government has decided to write off loans of over ₹964 crore taken by farmers from land development banks (LDBs) in the state. Over 34,000 farmers, who had taken loans from these banks over two decades ago, are set to benefit from the decision. It has also approved the payment of another ₹275.40 crore to employees of LDBs.

377.title: University accused of hiring 'pretty' teacher for attendance in China, reacts after criticism
377.article_body: A university in China's Henan province was widely criticised after it was accused of hiring a teacher named Zhang because of her looks to boost attendance. Refuting the allegations, the university said it "trusted her excellent teaching ability and decided to hire her". The accusations surfaced after teaching videos of Zhang, who has over 4.3 lakh TikTok followers, went viral.

378.title: US reacts after Kashmiri journalist stopped from flying to US to collect Pulitzer
378.article_body: US has reacted after Kashmiri journalist Sanna Irshad Mattoo said she wasn't allowed to board a flight from Delhi to US to collect her Pulitzer Prize. "We...are tracking these developments closely. We are committed to supporting press freedom...A shared commitment to democratic values, including the respect for the independence of the press, is a bedrock of US-India relationship," US said.

379.title: PhonePe in talks to raise funds at $12 billion valuation: Report
379.article_body: PhonePe is in talks to raise funds from General Atlantic at over $12 billion valuation, Moneycontrol reported. General Atlantic is likely to lead the funding round with $450-$500 million investment. The investment would make the Walmart-backed startup the most-valued fintech in India. This will reportedly not be a pre-IPO round as PhonePe’s public listing is 2-3 years away.

380.title: Suzlon Energy's ₹1,200-crore rights issue subscribed 1.8 times
380.article_body: Suzlon Energy, on Thursday, said that its ₹1,200-crore rights issue has been subscribed by 1.8 times. The 240 crore partly paid-up equity shares for cash were issued from October 11 to October 20. The allotment and listing formalities of the new shares on the BSE and the NSE are expected to be completed by the first week of November.

381.title: Iranian troops in Crimea helping Russia in its war on Ukraine: US
381.article_body: Iran has deployed military experts in Crimea to help Russian forces conduct attacks on Ukraine's infrastructure and civilian population with Iran-made drones, the US alleged. The US will "pursue all means" to "expose, deter and confront Iran's provision of these munitions against...Ukrainians", US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said. Russia annexed Crimea from Ukraine in 2014.

382.title: 192 private bus operators fined ₹14.96 lakh over ticket fares in Pune
382.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office fined 192 private bus operators ₹14.96 lakh in a week for increasing ticket fares. "There are clear and strict guidelines...private tourist bus operators cannot increase fares more than 1.5 times compared to Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation fares," an official said. "Action was taken for overcharging passengers and overcrowding buses," the official added.

383.title: 5 policemen assault couple who refused to share hookah in Gurugram
383.article_body: Five policemen were suspended after they allegedly assaulted an elderly couple at their house in a village in Gurugram. The incident occurred after the couple apparently refused to share their hookah with the policemen, who were in plain clothes, as they appeared to be drunk. "Two of the accused were carrying weapons and threatening [the couple]," the couple's son claimed.

384.title: Delhi woman who accused 5 men of gangrape, inserting rod filed fake case: UP Police
384.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad have said a Delhi woman's complaint alleging that five men gangraped her and inserted a rod in private parts was a "made up and fabricated case". Police stated that the case was planned to nail the five men over a land dispute. Her three friends have been arrested on the basis of their confessional statement.

385.title: B'luru Metro barricades on Outer Ring Road to be removed by Sep 2023
385.article_body: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced a schedule for the removal of barricades placed across the city owing to construction work. It said that the Metro barricades would be removed from the entire stretch of the Outer Ring Road by September 2023. Barricades on Doddenakundi-DRDO Sports Complex will be removed by February 2023, it added.

386.title: Chinese woman living as Nepali monk in Delhi arrested, police say 'she may be a spy'
386.article_body: A Chinese woman suspected of spying has been arrested from a Tibetan refugee settlement in Delhi. Her identity papers showed her name as Dolma Lama, with an address in Nepal's capital Kathmandu, the police said. The woman, whose real name is Cai Ruo, was living under the disguise of a Buddhist monk.

387.title: 4 persons hunt turtles to cook their meat in Pune; arrested
387.article_body: Four people who were allegedly hunting turtles to cook their meat have been arrested in Pune. The forest department made the arrests after they went to check the house of one of the accused and found pieces of turtles in a cooking utensil near it. The accused were arrested under different sections of the Wild Life (Protection) Act.

388.title: Delhi Police seizes 13,700 kg firecrackers in Oct, 75 cases registered
388.article_body: Delhi Police seized over 13,700 kilograms of firecrackers from October 1 to 19 and registered 75 cases for storage or sale. Police registered six cases in connection with bursting of firecrackers in October. Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai recently said that bursting firecrackers on Diwali will attract a jail term of six months and a fine of ₹200.

389.title: Ronaldo releases statement after getting dropped for Chelsea game over walkout controversy
389.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has released a statement after getting dropped for Chelsea match. Ronaldo, who stormed down the tunnel during match against Tottenham, said, "I've always tried to set...example...for...youngsters...[but] sometimes...heat of the moment gets the best of us." "This is Manchester United...and united we must stand. Soon we'll be together again," he added.

390.title: 25-yr-old man killed as vehicle hits bike in Gurugram, his friend critical
390.article_body: A 25-year-old labourer was killed while his friend was injured after the motorcycle that they were travelling on was hit by an unidentified vehicle in Gurugram, reports said. The deceased's friend is currently undergoing treatment and his condition is said to be critical. Reports said that no arrests have been made in the case as of now.

391.title: Elon Musk plans to lay off 75% of Twitter's workforce: Report
391.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has told prospective investors that he intends to lay off nearly 75% of Twitter's 7,500-member workforce, Washington Post reported citing documents. The report said that Twitter's current management planned to cut almost a quarter of the workforce, paring $800 million from company's payroll. Musk is expected to close the purchase of Twitter by October 28.

392.title: Sehwag picks Pakistan captain Babar Azam to be 2022 T20 WC's top-scorer
392.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has picked Pakistan captain Babar Azam to end up being the 2022 T20 World Cup's top-scorer. "Babar has been extraordinary...There is a sense of calmness whenever Virat Kohli bats and you get something similar when watching Babar," added Sehwag. Interestingly, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan also picked Babar to be the top-scorer in the tournament.

393.title: Robotic surgery far superior to conventional surgery: B'luru doctors
393.article_body: According to doctors in Bengaluru, robot-assisted surgery is revolutionising healthcare and is far superior to conventional surgery. "Robot-assisted surgery gives better results. Patients have less pain and they are able to get back to work early and get back to their normal lifestyle," said Dr Jagadish J Hiremath, Founder of the AASRA Group of Hospitals.

394.title: List shows areas in Bengaluru which will face power cuts today
394.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) said parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts today as the Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation will be undertaking some maintenance works. The divisions which will remain affected are - Ramanagara, Whitefield, Additional East Shivajinagar division, and Tiptur. The power outages will occur for five hours between 10 am and 3 pm.

395.title: Fake policeman replaces tailor's gold worth ₹70,000 with milk packets in Mira Bhayandar
395.article_body: A man posing as a policeman robbed a 58-year-old tailor of his gold ornaments worth ₹70,000. The man told the tailor, who was walking back home, that a robbery had taken place and asked him to place the gold ornaments he wore in the man's handkerchief for safety. The tailor found empty milk packets in the handkerchief after reaching home.

396.title: Unable to get job, drunkard kidnaps sister near Mumbai; demands ransom
396.article_body: A 25-year-old man kidnapped his five-year-old cousin and demanded ransom from her family near Mumbai on Wednesday, as he was unable to get a job and wanted to fuel his alcoholism. The accused took the victim out, offering to get her sweets, but later demanded ₹1 lakh from her family to return her safe and sound, a police officer said.

397.title: Celebrate your Nayi Shuruat ki #PehliDiwali with Alekhya: Tanishq
397.article_body: Tanishq shared that it is celebrating every new beginning in its 'Nayi Shuruat ki #PehliDiwali' campaign urging everyone to rejoice in milestones with a reminder that when you celebrate your own 'nayi shuruat,' every Diwali feels like your #PehliDiwali. It unveiled the Alekhya collection inspired by the intricate art of Pichwai, available across all Tanishq stores.

398.title: Around 50 killed in anti-government protests: Chad Prime Minister
398.article_body: Around 50 people were killed and dozens were injured on Thursday in the anti-government protests in Chad, said Prime Minister Saleh Kebzabo. Violence started after protesters, who are demanding a swift transition to democratic rule, set ablaze the prime minister's party headquarters. "What happened today is an armed popular uprising...those responsible...will face justice," said Kebzabo.

399.title: Boris Johnson could be in race to replace UK PM Truss: Report
399.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson may enter the race to replace Liz Truss as the Conservative Party's leader, The Times reported. "He's (Johnson) taking soundings but is said to believe it is a matter of national interest," The Times Political Editor Steven Swinford tweeted. Liz Truss resigned on Thursday as UK Prime Minister after just 45 days in office.

400.title: AAP releases 6th list of 20 candidates for Gujarat elections
400.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday released its sixth list of 20 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. It has fielded Parvat Vagodia from Santrampur, Dinesh Munia from Dahod, Viral Panchal from Manjalpur, Mahendra Navadiya from Surat North, Sunit Gamit from Dang and Chetan Gajera from Junagadh. The party has declared 73 candidates for the elections so far.

401.title: Namibia record highest-ever 8th wicket partnership in T20 World Cup history
401.article_body: Namibia recorded the highest-ever partnership for the eighth wicket in T20 World Cup history. Ruben Trumpelmann and David Wiese shared a 70-run stand against UAE in a T20 World Cup 2022 first round match to set the record. The previous record was held by England's Moeen Ali and David Willey, who shared a 57*-run stand against Afghanistan in 2016 edition.

402.title: Ronaldo dropped from Man Utd squad for Chelsea match for storming down the tunnel
402.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has been dropped from Manchester United squad for the Premier League match against Chelsea. This comes after Ronaldo stormed down the tunnel in 90th minute against Tottenham Hotspur on Wednesday. Ronaldo, who was named as substitute, was not brought on to play against Tottenham. "Rest of the squad is fully focused on preparing for [Chelsea match]," United said.
